Reviews.Title: “A Good Enough Stay On The Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: patravels_7
Reviews.Content: We vacationed here with our son and we found the Paradise Plaza to be an average, older hotel with a great location that we would consider returning to when on a budget. The rooms and bathrooms were large. The kitchen was great. The staff was helpful. The ocean front price was reasonable. Wi-fi worked out nicely. Discounts at the bar (we didn't partake, but it's a good deal). Here are our concerns...all 3 of us developed allergies during our stay and found our room to be a bit musty. The AC unit is old and "kicks on" very loudly and often woke me up. The pool is behind the property off the parking lot (the photo on the website masks that very well), near the dumpsters. We did not use the pool because it was such a blah environment. My biggest pet peeves were the balcony and parking. If you value privacy, the standard oceanfront balconies will disappoint. You sit less than 4 feet from your neighbors, and we were unlucky to have a large crowd of smokers next door. We rarely used the balcony for this reason. If we stay there again, I would insist on a corner unit that would at least have only 1 neighbor, or the suite balconies which looked huge. Aside from the lack of privacy, the balcony was filthy and the management should SERIOUSLY consider new deck chairs. We had to bring a towel outside to sit each time. Parking is VERY limited at this property, so if you can't park in their main lot you have to park a block away. We had to park in the second lot one night and it's remote and not secure, not to mention inconvenient when you have luggage. If we return to OC, we will likely find a more updated hotel...but we would return here for a short stay knowing what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite OC hotel”
Reviews.Author: pmcc44
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay this year and we just love it. The rooms are large, nice and clean. We stayed on a lower floor this time and it was really nice. We did the managers special with the champagne and food vouchers – wonderful! The staff was really helpful and we asked for a higher floor with the Jacuzzi (usually we have this but we made the reservation very last minute and the hotel was all booked) and the lady at the front desk was really helpful and found us one but the room wasn’t ready quite yet - only because we got there 4 hours early 12 pm when check-in is at 4 so we took the early check in the lower room (she let us look at the room beforehand ) but that's what so wonderful about this hotel. She gave us our choice, was very helpful and we are truly thankful. We also stayed at the hotel in June and had the best room ever (except it was senior week and if you're under 25 I would suggest a different time..lol) We're in our 50s but we had the Marlin suite (805 – I think) with an ocean front balcony and a huge side balcony than was the length of our room. Talk about wonderful!!! Nothing can beat it. Also location - location -location. Prime boardwalk with an umbrella stand right outside the hotel on the beach. Great if you love to people watch. Btw – September is a very nice time – days are warm, water is warm and nothing is crowded. We are going back next year for a full week!! Love Ocean City and the Paradise Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Darlene B
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay there for my second honey moon (39 years married ) .The hotel had a pacage plan for two nights which came with champange plus glasses and also gave us 40.00 voucher for their restaurantand 10.00 vouchersfor everyday we were there.The rooms were big ,clean, coffee machine,micro wave and small refrig. the employees helped you when you had a question about anyting.I would even take mywhole family there it's family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Stacie S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our anniversary getaway. You couldn't ask for a better location. The room was nice and the staff was friendly. We stayed in room 803. It had an ocean front balcony 2 queen beds and a sleep sofa. The bathroom had plenty of counter space, a jacuzzi tub with shower and a heating lamp. We would definitely stay here again!!! Maybe when we come back down with the kids in October for the teacher's convention.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: Shirron K
Reviews.Content: I was planning my family's first vacation to the beach when I booked a room way further away from the Boardwalk than I wanted to be. I did not know how far away we were until we received the Ocean City travel guide in the mail. After looking through the guide and reading SEVERAL reviews, we opted to book a "partial view" room at the Paradise Plaza Inn (and we paid just over $200 less than the original hotel that was booked). We could not have been happier with our decision!!!! We were right on the Boardwalk and loved it.This was the first time my daughter's stayed in a hotel and they were amazed and in awe of the views that we had and the space that we had in our room. The balcony was great and so spacious!! The room was clean and our housekeeper was the sweetest lady :) I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants amazing views at a great price!!!! The staff was AWESOME and very friendly. My son needed sheets for the pull-out bed and they were so accomodating and quick!! We will see you all next year!!!! Thank you for being a part of our first trip to the beach!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Lilsassy
Reviews.Content: Great location staff was friendly and helpful with everything. The only issue was the fire alarm. It seems like every time I stay here is just keeps going off. I had my mom with me who has bad asthma and had issues with having to keep walking up and down the steps.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot for my First Visit to Ocean City!”
Reviews.Author: Madelon M
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I wanted to go to Ocean City over Labor Day weekend but we were having a horrible time finding a place to stay. The Paradise Plaza was one of the only hotels that would allow us to book only 2 nights instead of 3 which was awesome. The girl that helped me over the phone was really sweet and the manager of the hotel even re-sent me my confirmation email after I booked the room because my email address at work usually blocks things. The location was awesome - right on the boardwalk, a bus stop is right out front, a great pizza place called Mambos is around the block (open 24hrs) and overall the room was clean and bright. The balcony was really nice as well. The staff was great as well. Lana who works the front desk was very helpful and it seemed like everyone overall was friendly. My boyfriend and I loved Ocean City and we will be back soon - and staying at the Paradise Plaza will be part of that plan!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: Molo8027
Reviews.Content: Definitely not luxury but ok for sleeping and good for the price. Spend most of your time on the beach and boardwalk. The tap room grille looks like a biker hangout and not suitable for family dining. Rooms are outdated and balconies have carpet that has never been cleaned but the location is awesome and parking is free. Wifi connection is slow but lots of cable channels. Again, not bad for the cost of you don't need a high-end hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, great service.”
Reviews.Author: TadRodgers
Reviews.Content: Prior to my stay at the Paradise Plaza Inn, I would not have favored having tile flooring in my room. However, considering the amount of sand that we drug in from the beach, I can see how tile is a much easier surface for the cleaning crew to maintain over time. The overall rating I've seen on the internet for this hotel is listed as a three-star, I can't argue too much with that. To drill down more specifically, I would put it somewhere between 2-1/2 and 3. I believe that the criteria that work against the rating would be the fact that it is an older facility, and the weather at Ocean City I would think is brutal on any structure. The air-conditioning system was much louder than I would prefer, but the efficiency with which it cooled the room made it very tollerable. The bonus points that made our stay satisfying was with the extremely courteous and professional service that we recieved from the entire staff, the clean room, comfortable bed linen, and the use of quality towels in the bathrooms. When at the beach if I feel comfortable cleaning up from a long day in the surf and can sleep comfortably, I'm a happy camper.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: joemacg
Reviews.Content: This is a great place with a great location. The balcony is great and the rooms are very spacious. The front desk is very friendly. The only drawback would be the location of the pool which is very small and located in the front of the hotel in the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay on the boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: dave s
Reviews.Content: In a location with about 1,000,000 places to stay, there are not many good choices on the boardwalk. I think they finally built a Courtyard and maybe one other safe bet but I will be staying at the Paradise because the price is right. Its not a 4-5 star hotel but maybe a 3 or high end two that is clean, has adequate space and comfortable beds. Bonus that it has a decent restaurant on the property and is right on the boardwalk. We only stay for 2-3 nights each year and its the right fit for us. Family friendly for sure but probably more for groups of friends or couples for a brief weekend trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this property. Was extremely well kept and maintained.....”
Reviews.Author: j g
Reviews.Content: LOL, but my happiest moment was actually downstairs at their Dairy Queen when I discovered they had cupcakes in Sesame Street characters that were very good..... and my children loved shopping at the sunstation.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!”
Reviews.Author: Tommy L
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had such an amazing time here last week. The hotel is very nice for a boardwalk hotel and the location is amazing. The service is also a strong point. We had the honey moon suite which included 2 balconies and in bedroom jacuzzi. Everything was very clean and the huge bed was super comfortable. We normally stay at the Hilton so our expectations are high,but just couldnt afford it this summer. The paradise plaza filled all our expectations at about 1/2 the price. Now this hotel could use some MINOR updating, like some touchup paint here and there but overall it is SUPER!! The parking is a little tight and we had to use the overflow lot quite a bit, which was not a big deal to us. We are semi-picky people and this hotel exceeded our expectations. Cant wait til next summer to stay here again!! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: flukens
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived the parking lot was awful. We had to circle the lot like 3 times till someone else left. We also drove somewhere one night & could not find parking when we returned...so we had to pay $25 for off street parking. The balcony door in our room was broken & the peice holding the door to keep from sliding open was electrical taped. The only pro I found to this hotel was the beds! They were super comfy! Everything else in room was your typical hotel room. Nothing spectacular. It was also at a great location & right on the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “See you next year!!”
Reviews.Author: bigmamaflick
Reviews.Content: This is the second year we have spent here and it just keeps getting better and better! The room was very large and clean and the ocean front view was perfect. Getting rid of the "70's" bed spreds and replacing them with modern ones made the room feel as if we were at home. The room service was wonderful! We ran out of towels the second day, so I called down to the desk and room service brought us towels within 10 minutes. The location is perfect, the room was very clean, and the staff was wonderful! We even got a returning customer discount which made the vacation even more wonderful! The only thing that would make this hotel any better would be if they had conjoining rooms. We had 9 people in our party and my parents and sister were placed on a lower floor. Even if we could have had rooms next to each other, this would have been the perfect vacation!!! Thank you for making this vacation as close to perfect as possible!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay ...”
Reviews.Author: MsCrabie
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here. I was very surprised I didn't know what to expect seeing I have never been there before. The hotel was clean but a little old. It was in the middle of everything.The people at the front desk were very friendly and helpful we asked to check out an hour later and they said it was ok with no problems even they they do not do it in the summer time. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: Jackie W
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful vacation recently with Paradise Plaza Inn. They by far exceeded our expectations!! We booked an oceanfront room with a balcony and jacuzzi. We were extremely surprised and thrilled to also have a LARGE private deck off the side of our room. This was a huge bonus. The staff was exceptional. From early check-in to late check-out, telling us we could bring our bikes up to the deck-that it was "our room, to use as we wished", to cleaning up and making our beds everyday (thank you Nancy!!). We had the best week of our life and felt very safe and respected here. We debate on staying in a condo each year, when we come to Ocean City but after our stay this year with you guys, we just can't even consider it. Thanks again. We hope to be back soon. Jackie Greathouse

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Nicole0717
Reviews.Content: This is the second year we have stayed here. It is conveniently located and reasonably priced. The room was moderate, but clean. The front desk was friendly upon check-in. We stay during them off season so I can't speak to their accommodations during the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Constant H
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights, 2 ocean side rooms on the fifth floor. Cleaning staff while friendly did not do a very good job. Couple of days no wash cloths, rooms cleaned after 4 most days even though we were not in the rooms. Beds were sloppily made. Talked to manager and he was quick to say he would take care of it and did I just should have asked quicker. Parking was bad, no room and noticed quite a few cars with no tag and getting out of cars and going to the beach, don't believe they were guests as the cars would be gone at night. Also a lack of luggage carts. Now the good parts, Rooms were spacious, balcony was great, close to everything, and for the most part very clean. The front desk staff were very nice, and helpful, always had a smile. So overall we had a great experience and would recommend this fine hotel and will be back next year, only wish we had tried this place when we first came to OC years ago. Thanks for helping to make my families vacation a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Deborah W
Reviews.Content: Paradise Plaza Inn was in a great location, right on the boardwalk. It was near restaurants and arcades for the kids. They give you free bottles of water. The hotel was clean, which is very important for me. It's not the most updated but we didn't stay in the room much. We looked at it as a vacation for the kids..nothing fancy. We were in room 310 which was a handicapped room. This was all they had available. I read that some TV's were flat screen, ours was not. We had a partial ocean view, which was great, but they should replace their balcony chairs. They used to be white. Don't worry about the hallways being warm, because the A/C in the room worked great. The only thing I didn't like was that the pool was right outside of the hotel in the Parking Lot, full of sand. I'm just used to hotel pools being attached to the hotel. We would stay here again. Best Value.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere off boardwalk if possible, not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Patricia V
Reviews.Content: 1) pubic hairs on sheets and bathroom floor 2) paid for room with 2 beds and sofa bed but given room with just two beds 2a) had to complain to Hotels.com to get roll a way at no charge as hotel wanted to charge $10 per day due to the fact they gave away our room to another gues 2b) their claim? But we gave you a jaccuzi tub at no charge! I wouldn't bathe in that thing if you had drenched it in liquid gold. The scum and whatever was floating on the jets is enough to make you wear flip flops while showering 3) rude staff 4) slow and very hot elevators 5) staff uses elevators and when I tried to close the door, a janitor entered with a trash can someone threw up in. Said, sorry you are going to have to smell this during the ride. Why didn't he wait for an empty elevator instead of make me get off and walk down 6 flights? 6) no hot water in the kitchenette While I realize that keeping a place a the beach with salt air is difficult, general cleanliness and maintenance are just operational things. Ripping people off at $350 per night should be illegal!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer T
Reviews.Content: For our first time in Ocean City we really enjoyed our stay at Paradise Plaza Inn. The hotel is in a prime location. We had easy access to the beach, many activities, restaurants and points of interest. Our room was on the 4th floor with a partial ocean view. I was worried about this but the view turned out to be amazing !!!!! The staff was very friendly and courteous. We opted for no housekeeping, but when we called to the front desk to have more towels brought up and our trash emptied there was a knock at our door within 15 minutes. The kitchenettes came in very handy and the beds very very comfortable. The only thing we had issues with was the parking lot. We had a rough time finding a place to park, although the additional lot was not far away. This is expected when so many hotels are trying to pack a large building, a pool and parking lot on their property. The pool was clean and refreshing, and had nice lounge chairs. It was also nice to have quick access to a restaurant and shops in the bottom of the hotel. We will be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Sara H
Reviews.Content: I have been going to this hotel for over 6 years now and each time I go I love it! I used to go down on a bus trip and then one year my finance and I decided to drive separate and the hotel still offered us the same discounted price as the bus trip- we were beyond happy!! The location is perfect and our rooms are always clean and ready. This hotel has become our summer getaway! Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Far from Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: w v
Reviews.Content: If they had a rating system in the negatives, this would be a -5. This has got to be one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. We paid for one room and they put us in a lower graded room with no excuse or refund. Pubic hairs were in the bed and all over the bathroom floor. This hotel should be condemned and investigated by the Health Department. DONT STAY HERE!!!! TOTAL RIP OFF!

Reviews.Title: “RUDE staff that takes advantage of their guest starting at manager level.”
Reviews.Author: Gina_3_15
Reviews.Content: The staff here at Paradise Plaza are dishonest, accusing, thieves. They are disrespectful to their guest and rather than addressing issues, these crooks actually turn issues around to make their paying guests at fault. I will NEVER return and would NEVER allow a friend of mine stay here. This issue was such a huge deal that a police report needed to be filed against the staff here. Consider this a warning! DO NOT BOOK A STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne G
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a great stay at the Paradise Plaza we arrived early and our room was ready for check in. We were on the 4th floor and had a nice ocean view, the room was very clean and the front desk staff were very helpful. Execellet location, can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time!”
Reviews.Author: Stacy M
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay. Room was very clean, and just as described. Air conditioner was ICE COLD! Loved the ocean front view. Safe was an excellent idea and very useful, not something we have ever seen in our Ocean City stays. Staff was very nice and helpful. We only have 2 suggestions. First a chain or bar lock on the inside of the door. Even with the bolt on when small children pull on the handle it opens right up and off they go! Second it is understood there is no comfortable pull out bed, that said the matress in our room was very stained (with what looked to be blood)on both sides and very uncomfortable probably should be replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: mike w
Reviews.Content: There was 7 of us in the room for my daughters 21st birthday.Plenty of room for all of us.Surprisingly there was drawer space to spare.Excellent location.Will stay here again.Next year I might try an ocean front room.

Reviews.Title: “vacation”
Reviews.Author: john m
Reviews.Content: place was good and service was great. room was clean and ready before we got there. only down fall was the coffee maker was 1 cup. not enough when you drink alot of coffee, so bring your own maker other than that its a good place to stay . will be making res for next year there

Reviews.Title: “OK for one night”
Reviews.Author: Kelly817
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was the best part. We arrived early, checked in and gave our number so they could call when the room was ready. The parking was horrible and not all the cars had the tags for the hotel so obviously it's not monitored. Around 4:15 I still didn't get a call, we checked back at the desk and the room had been ready for an hour. Elevators took forever!!!! Finally arrived on the 6th floor, so hot in the hallways!!!! Got into our room and our bath robes had stains on them, the patio door didn't lock, the floor was sandy,our toilet didn't flush right, dresser drawers didn't open and it could certainly use some updates on the tv and furniture. The AC worked great but the beds were uncomfortable and the pool was impossible to get into since it was so small. All in all, only good for one night.

Reviews.Title: “conscientious service”
Reviews.Author: tobiasj
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with the level of unsolicited help from all of your staff. As I fumbled with the electronic key to open my hotel door, a member of the housekeeping staff, sensing my struggle, freely offered her assistance. That was greatly welcomed. This experience was repeated with the other staff members all through our stay. Our room was clean and well appointed. Given the great location and still quiet feel of the hotel, I am sure we will return. Thanks again for this pleasant hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Great Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: FeFe26
Reviews.Content: I always stay here a couple times a years....for my Birthday and my Grandparents Anniversary. We arrived On Monday July 23rd and this time I also brought a friend and her 5 year old son for the first time and they loved loved loved their stay! Everyone here especially at the front desk is always very nice and helpful. My family and friends always have nothing but nice things to say and are always looking forward to their next stay here. The room is always comfortable and clean and we are always in a great location. Ocean City is our fav beach spot and Paradise Plaza is our fav Hotel! Wouldnt stay anywhere else. Thank you once again!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Sandee R
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel July 8th to the 12th for the first time. Did not know what to expect. Arrived earlier than check in time thought we would have to find something to do for a few hours. But or room was ready. People at front desk were great. Had a ocean side room but the view was good. Room was clean. Oh and the air cond. worked better than mine at home. I really recommend this hotel for a nice vacation. Location is also a plus on the boradwalk. Ready to stay there again in Sept.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tina H
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Sunday July 15th. We arrived earlier in the morning and decided to go to the beach. We stopped into the hotel to let them know we were there. They were wonderful!!!. The girls at the front desk gave us our parking passes for the parking lot and asked for a phone number in the event our room was ready early. As it turned out, our room was ready three hours early. We had an ocean front room, with large comfortable beds, a large bathroom and plenty of room. We stayed on the 8th floor with a remarkable view of the boardwalk. The air conditioning in the room was wonderful since it was so very hot during our stay. The housekeeping staff was great and was very helpful in getting us extra towels and sheets for the pull out sofa. The Taphouse restaurant was a great place to eat. Only issue was that the air conditioning was not working and they were working on getting it fixed. That really didn't matter because even though it was hot, with the windows and doors open, there was a nice breeze. This was our first stay in this hotel. I usually don't book on the boardwalk because of the noise, but you could not hear a sound in the room with the balcony door closed and the location was great for the beach. I also liked the fact that you could get to the beach through the Sunsations store that was below the hotel. Overall it was a great stay, can not say anything negative about the hotel or the staff. Very clean rooms, and the very friendly staff. Always saying good morning and asking if there was anything they could do. My kids had a great time, did not have to worry if they went downstairs on their own. It was great and would absolutely book there again for next year. The manager was wonderful to speak to, as I had to call him three days before we left. He was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, But Good Time in Ocean City, MAryland”
Reviews.Author: Acgolfer27767
Reviews.Content: This is how the story started. We were at the Sheraton in Norfolk and we were looking for a hotel in Ocean City because we were checking out and going to Ocean City that next day. We found this hotel and we loved the pictures because they looked so nice online. So we decided to book it. When we got there we pulled in and got our stuff out of the car. When we came in and were checking in the person at the counter wanted payment from us for our stay. My dad said "well can we see the room first". The person at the counter just told us our room number and seemed disgusted that we wanted to see it. We noticed on the floor we were staying on was smoke. We went down to upgrade our room and the manager had to come out and help the person at the counter. When we finally got up to our room we could find it but it was the wrong room number. We went back down to the desk and got the right room number. When we went into our room I noticed that there was a bar keeping the slider door from opening and no lock. I opened the door and saw lots of rusty gross staples. The only privacy you get is a divider . The room was nice but the T.V. buttons were broken so we had to use the remote. The floor was comfortable on your feet and the beds were comfortable also. If you are a family and you dislike smoke this place may not be for you. If you look closely from standing on the board walk you can see a big black spot up on the smoke stack wall. If you want a view of the beach I would suggest to bring more money with you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place & Service”
Reviews.Author: el51769
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, great location & clean rooms. This was our first trip to OC & enjoyed every minute of it. I have to be honest, when looking for a hotel, there weren't many choices that allowed smoking & that was one of the reasons I picked this hotel. But after staying here, I would recommend it to everyone, smoking or not. It was a wonderful experience from arrival to departure. We arrived on one of the hottest days & upon entering our room it was set to a perfect temp to cool off & for a smoking room, I was amazed not to smell old smoke. The beds were so comfortable, I wish I could have strapped it to the roof of my car! LOL The staff was very friendly & even helped me with printing me directions for the ride home, since my gps died while down there. I was a little hesitant about staying on the boardwalk thinking it would be loud, but once the balcony door was closed, you could hear a pin drop. We had a partial-ocean view room, but was amazed at how beautiful the view was. Overall it was a perfect experience & would highly recommend to friends & DEFINATELY will be back next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation for Family of 11”
Reviews.Author: Nanette G
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. The location was perfect for my husband and I and our kids ranging from 21 down to 3. We enjoyed a great balcony view while being able to keep an eye on the kids in the evening whether they went back to the beach or on the boardwalk. We had two rooms but that was plenty of room. I'd like to reserve early enough for next year to get a suite. Happy vacationing to all!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: Dave H
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the first time at the Paradise Plaza Inn on the boardwalk in Ocean City Maryland. The rooms are large and clean. Tim the manager was very friendly & helpfull. The hotel's location was perfect & so convenient. I would definitely stay there again. Trying to re-book for next year already.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Judy R
Reviews.Content: This place is very clean and located at a nice spot on the boardwalk. Our family had a great time. The room is clean and spacious. We had a refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker and cabinet space. I would recommend this for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor management”
Reviews.Author: Jessica B
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were pleasantly surprised. The room was quite large and the hotel had an overall great location. On my reservation I asked for a crib as a special request. It wasn't in our room, no problem I tried to call the front desk. Called twice, rang about 15 times and no one answered. Still no problem and stopped by front desk to request one. The phone was unmarked so I asked the manager if I was supposed to dial zero? He said yes but I was here and no calls came in. I did call twice....he said "its not my fault" which seems like a strange overreaction. Ok...I just asked for a crib he said no problem. Of course when I returned - no crib. Back I go , same manager. He informs me no cribs left. The irony is that as he was tracking down the housekeeper to ask the phone was ringing off the hook. I said this is unacceptable, I paid $280 for this room (!). He said what do you want me to pull it out of my pocket? No "im sorry" at all. Overall I would not trust this hotel to offer any customer service if you have an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: Von1287
Reviews.Content: I really thought that this hotel was going to be like the tiny gross rooms in wildwood but to my surprise it was much more. We had a suite that was two rooms and if there had only been a bigger kitchen area it could be considered resort size. The beds were extremely comfortable by the way and the sheets were clean and comfy. They do bring you water each day if you allow housekeeping in which was nice. We also needed sheets for the pull out bed the first night and within 5 min of calling down we had fresh sheets warm from the dryer! The bathroom had some asthetically ugly parts, and there was a few dirty spots on the walls that were questionable, otherwise a clean room. I will say that the air conditioning unit was very loud and would start and stop to keep the air temp and it was very loud during any transition. No clocks in the rooms, no utensils or plates even though we had a refrigerator and a microwave. Location with his hotel is absolutely key. It is probably the most convenient hotel considering there is a bar/restaurant right downstairs. The boardwalk is right outside the door and the only bathroom on the boardwalk for 20 blocks is right there too! Awesome Awesome location!

Reviews.Title: “excellent accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Linda O
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in June of 2012. We were very happy with the size of our room, extremely clean, friendliness of the staff. Excellent location too. we will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite OC Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dawn M
Reviews.Content: Not sure if I want to share. I love this hotel. They give a great returning customer discount. We just returned from a week at the Paradise Plaza Inn. The rooms are huge with a large bathroom and jacuzzi tub. I love the complimentary bathrobes and water bottles. Such a nice touch you just dont see anymore. The location off of 9th street on the boardwalk is perfect. There is a Sunsations and T Shirt shop on the first floor. Make sure you tell them you are a guest at the hotel for a discount. Staff suggested a great place to eat for seafood and breakfast. From the outside the Paradise doesnt look that spectacular but rest assure it is. I really do not want to share this great hotel so dont take my word for it :)

Reviews.Title: “more than satisfied!!”
Reviews.Author: Jake D
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to ocean city every year for vacation(20+ years) and this was our first stay here. From check-in to check-out i enjoyed everything the paradise plaza had to offer. The room was spotless, staff went out of the way to accommodate our every need, great location, and the taphouse bar&grill great. My wife and kids agree that the paradise plaza inn will be the only place we will stay when we come back to ocean city.

Reviews.Title: “not for families”
Reviews.Author: Brian A
Reviews.Content: very unwilling to accommodate needs in general. very lazy staff and non responsive management. i called the hotel 2 days in advance to ask for an early check in because of logistics, and my twin babies needs. i was told verbally that it wouldn't be a problem over the phone. we arrived close to noon, and re advised the front desk staff of our situation. they took our number and said they would call. we waited patiently watching no less than a hundred people check in before us. while waiting i noticed a lady came to the desk and returned her key, and stated thanks for the late check out. this was at 3pm 3hrs later, it was very bad communication to have a family waiting with infants and to grant a late check out. this was just the star of the wait, check in is posted for 4pm we did not reach our room until after 530pm!!!! i have 2 year old twin sons, and i booked in February, and stated that i needed two cribs via reservation notes. i was given one crib and, a whole lot of grief. they sent a pack and play covered in excrement and a very rich unbearable smell. i was promised by management that they had ordered cribs and made due for the time. two days later the same pack and play was sent to my room, in a slightly better condition. it looked like someone hosed it off. the front desk and management never properly addressed the problem. i was offended by being ran in circles and non direct answers. my vacation was a disaster! my children were unable to sleep in one small crib. we had no place to lay them down for naps. there where a number of things that could have been done. there was absoloutely no attempts by the paradise plaza staff to meet my needs. it was very unpleasant i basically pleaded with some one everyday for help with no usable response. i have a family of six total including two teenage boys. we were on the 5th floor where the cleaning staff had its office, and supplies. this office was also apparently used on daily basis by the staff to smoke pot! the smell was unmistakable daily! no explanation, or compensation of any kind was offered for all the inconvenience's. not even a mention of fault or apology!

Reviews.Title: “Won't Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: Tasha0000
Reviews.Content: Was there June 28 -July 1, 2012. The location was good but the service was BAD!!! We had 2 rooms & neither room had a "Do Not Disturb" sign so we went down to get 1 & they said they don't have any you have to get them from house keeping & no one from house keeping was on duty. 1 other room had 2 on their door so I took 1 & we hand wrote 1 for the other room. The next day I flipped the sign over for housekeeping & they never showed up. We went downstairs to request housekeeping for both rooms. We came back from the beach 1 room had been cleaned & the other room only had the garbage dumped. We requested housekeeping a 2nd time before it got done. The same thing happened the following day except this time the room never got cleaned & we still never received our do not disturb signs either. I had a 2 yr old with me so you know the rooms gets dirty & we had dirty diapers. My housekeeper name was Mariana & she was the WORST.

Reviews.Title: “Just another day in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: lesliematheny
Reviews.Content: We stay in the 2 bedroom - 2 bath Dolphin suites. I wish they were ocean front! But they are beautiful rooms and very spacious. It is the PERFECT location on the Boardwalk. This is the 3rd time we've stayed at Paradise Plaza - and again I must say the staff is stand-out when it comes to friendliness. Just a very plesant staff. The hotel offers free bottled water, coffee, and name brand shampoos & soaps. The Tap House Restaurant offers very affordable prices. Parking is easy. The pool is big - bigger than most found on the Boardwalk. I just can't say enough.... very - very pleased.... Now -- just to figure out how to get the returning customer rates! I'm told they offer them! Oh - one more thing.... the beds are so comfortable! And fabulous comforters -- not those typical scratchy yucky "hotel" comforters!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our stay!”
Reviews.Author: ColonRN
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay here and were very happy. We had a mini suite, room 713. This worked out really well with 3 small children, having 2 separate rooms. We also had 2 balconies, a small one off the back of the hotel and a large side one with an ocean view. I was pleasantly surprised with the size of the ocean view balcony and the fact that it has 2 lounge chairs and a regular chair that fit easily. It was also nice that there was no roof above us due to the design of the building, so it was a very open balcony. I also was pleased with the view of the ocean, it was much better than I thought it would be when it said "partial view". The comforters on the beds were very clean and bright white and the beds were comfortable. The carpet/ceiling/couch could use some updating. Another downside was the bathroom was very small, much smaller than an ocean front regular room that our friends stayed in. You couldn't get the door open and walk in and around to the shower without running into the toilet, unless you closed the door first, so it took some maneuvering. I realize this can't really be helped and wasn't that big of a deal. The wifi also did not work, we gave up trying after a couple days. They said there were too many people on it. We loved having the fridge, and the small kitchenette area was nice, especially having a 2nd sink. The pool was a little disappointing, from the pictures you can't tell that it is literally in the parking lot. We actually didn't use it until the last day when I took my son there, and I was impressed by the cleanliness of the pool. The beach and boardwalk access at this hotel are great, we loved having a Dairy Queen under the hotel and also a beach bathroom happened to be right in front of the hotel which was convenient. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Year”
Reviews.Author: Terry M
Reviews.Content: This is our second year staying at the hotel. Last year we had ocean view which was beautiful! The room was very clean and the staff at the hotel were great! The maids were more than happy to give you anything you needed and made sure you were happy with your room. This year we had problems, but it was out of their control. We couldn't get into our room the first night due to mechanical failures with the air conditioning so they put us in another room for the night. It was a nice room with a bay view. The view was pretty. The next day we checked on our room and they still didn't have the unit fixed and they didn't know if it would be fixed that day or not. They sent us to the 8th floor to check out a room they had that we could stay in for the rest of our stay. It wasn't the original type of room we booked. We booked a room with a jacuzzi. It was a large room with a king size bed and LARGE balcony. We had partial view of the ocean. It was on the 8th floor, which is the top floor of the hotel, and the view was amazing! You could see everything! At night it was beautiful with all of the lights from the hotels. Since we did not get our original room and we were inconvienced, they did not charge us for the rest of the week. We got 3 nights free. We only had to pay for the first night. My sister and her husbands family have been staying there for over 8 years and go back every year. They also had a situation one year with their room and they gave them two nights free for the following year. We will be back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Annual Visitors”
Reviews.Author: Jessica P
Reviews.Content: This is the second year i've stayed at the hotel and have had great experiences both years. The employees we were in contact with were very friendly and willing to help, never felt like a bother to anyone. The room was very clean, loved having the free bottles of water in there, ample space. The oceanfront rooms are definately worth it. We enjoyed looking over the boardwalk and the beds were very comfortable. Had a late check in and the security guard offered to help us find a place to park as the lot was full. Will definately be staying at this hotel again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Ben7476
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at this hotel. It was clean and convenient. We chose a non- smoking ocean front room on a non- smoking floor. There were two different groups of guests that stayed in the ocean front room next to us during our stay that smoked on their balcony. The smoke drifted over to our balcony. We did complain to the front desk and they said they would call and tell them that smoking was not permitted on the balconies on non-smoking floors. When it happened again with the next group of guests, I confronted them myself. We have never had to deal with this before. The hotel clerk mentioned that the smoking policy might be changed in January to a completely non- smoking hotel. that's what it will take for us to return next year,

Reviews.Title: “Not the best on the OC boards.”
Reviews.Author: 2012Happy2012
Reviews.Content: I really did NOT like this hotel. The outside of the hotel from the boardwalk looks very inviting, but this place is NO PARADISE to me,especially for the price!!! The hotel pool was tiny & had a view of the parking lot. It was dark & dim. Everything was old & did not feel very clean. IMO if the hotel is SUPER CLEAN that makes it for me. I suggest: new bright paint, bright white bed spreads,better lighting & a deep clean,everywhere. Then it might seem more like Paradise. On the upside the location can't be beat.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EileenH516
Reviews.Content: Just got back and really enjoyed our stay. Hotel is centrally located and could not have been happier with our accomidations. Our room was quite spacious. We had an oceanview room on the top floor and the veiw was stunning. We have booked an ocean front room for our next trip. Tim and his staff could not have been any nicer to us.I would suggest that if you like your morning coffee to bring your machine from home as the coffee maker in the room is quite small. In additon upon our checking in we were given $10.00 daily coupons for the Tap House...Best BLT and IPA Beers. We had a wonderful tme and can not wait to come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Anxious to return”
Reviews.Author: pranzeroh
Reviews.Content: After not visiting O.C. for many years we decided to go there in April.We stayed at the Paradise Plaza and what a nice find.We liked it so much we returned there in June for a 2 night stay and already have a room booked for Sept.We stayed on the 6th.floor end room with 2 balconies.Awsome views and a really nice room.Very clean and well maintained.We were there at the beginning of Senior week so parking was a problem.The only other glitch we had was the wifi did not work our 1st.night there and the desk clerk said it was because the hotel was full and to many people were using it.He kind of just brushed me off.The next morning we asked the desk clerk about it and she immediately called the maint .man to reset the router and the wifi worked find the rest of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again”
Reviews.Author: michah01
Reviews.Content: The hotel wasn't bad- the elevators were a little dirty and the taphouse bar inside sucked really bad, but the location was great and the room had lots of amenities. We were on the top floor corner and had 2 balconies. of course, the balcony doors didn't lock, but we left them open most of the time anyways. The jacuzzi tub is awesome and the fridge was nice and clean. plenty of towels. the pool is small but it never got crowded b/c everyone went to the beach. parking is kinda bad b/c if you don't get a spot there, you have to go across the street, but if you get a good spot, just walk everywhere. it was fine, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: tiffsphotos09
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night and we arrived really early and they were able to get us in 1 1/2 earlier than our check in time at 4. that was so helpful since we had kids with us! Also our room was really nice big spa hot tub in the bathroom and we had 2 balconys. The view was beautiful and we were right along the boardwalk with shops in the bottom of our hotel! staff was very helpful and printed directions home for us, We will def stay here again when we come back to ocean city!!

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love, Love this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: faltraz22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paradise Plaza last weekend and attended the OC car show. The hotel was great with speedy check in…thanks to Jag & Ronald, wonderful hospitality and customer service. The hotel accommodations were great! I had an ocean view room, on the side of the hotel but still a good view of the ocean. The beds were comfortable and the room was very spacious, the TV’s could use an upgrade, but that was the least of my worries….I was never in the room. The hotel was just steps from the beach with everything in walking distance. I had trouble finding a parking space one night and Jag was very helpful calling security to assist me with finding a space! If you’re going to Ocean City Paradise is the place to be, can’t wait to go back!!!!! THANKS for a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on the Boardwalk!”
Reviews.Author: angelene175
Reviews.Content: I am a longtime visitor of OC, MD. In my younger days, I would stay back off the boards because it was cheaper, but now that I have a little one, it is prudent for me to stay on the boardwalk because it is just so much easier to get around with a little person. I was a bit skeptical of staying here because of some of the bad reviews, but we had a two night gift certificate so we decided to give it a try. First of all, I wanted to mention that although we had a 2 night GC, we stayed for 5 nights and the rate for the other 3 nights couldn't be beat for a boardwalk hotel of this caliber. Our stay was in early June, and we typically come in late June so I can't say for sure what difference that made. Usually though, we don't get away with paying less than $200/night, and our rate was less than this. The rooms themselves were bigger than any other beach hotel we stayed at. We did not have one of the luxury rooms, we had a regular side view "ocean view" room, but it truly was large for a regular beach hotel room. (We did get to see one of the more luxury rooms while walking by, and they are very nice!) The balconies were large and spacious, and the railings seemed very secure. The sliding door locks to prevent little ones from wandering out onto the balcony were excellent, which is so important for us. ALL of the staff were very friendly. When we needed new towels, they were promptly delivered to our room. The showers could use new shower heads, but that is truly the only thing that I didn't find excellent, and really, as long as I can get the sand washed off of me I don't really care all that much about that. Entry to the boardwalk was through the downstairs sunsations, which will give you a 10% discount for staying in the hotel...also some of the most friendly people you will meet. They knew me after being there for a couple of days and always had a friendly hello and smile for me. The other thing I wanted to mention as a positive for this hotel, as far as their management--we received this gift certificate as part of a work Christmas exchange, in which the coordinator of our resort exchanges hotel stays with PPI, and the gift certificate is given to one of the employees of our resort at our Christmas party. Knowing our coordinator very well, I know how hard it is to get any beach hotels to be a part of this exchange. Just the fact that this hotel was willing to participate is an awesome show of good business practice and we thank them for that. Also, on the GC, it said "not valid" and had written two dates, which were memorial day and labor day. When our coordinator called to clarify, it was said that it meant not valid only on those weekends. When I called to make the reservations, she said it wasn't valid between those dates, but when explained that she had recently said only those weekends, she was fine with letting us use it for the dates we chose (thank you GG!). Wherever the misunderstanding occurred, she knew that it was more important to keep a happy customer than it was to bicker over validity dates on a gift certificate, and because of it, she gained a family that will probably continue to stay at this hotel for years to come, that she wouldn't have gained otherwise. I can't say enough for this hotel. Good hotel, good, friendly employees, and good management. We will be back and you should too!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Jen D
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Paradise Plaza Inn back in Feb of 2012 and there were a few bumps but that didn't keep us away from this hotel. My family loves to stay here! We stayed for three days over Springfest Weekend and had a great time! It is so close to everything, right on the boardwalk, and the staff is amazing! The room was clean and the jacuzzi tub was so relaxing. Our room not only had a front balcony but we also had an amazing side balcony that had lounge chairs that were perfect for enjoying the sun and still being right at room! The main reason I love this hotel so much is simply for the oceanfront views because you can lay on the bed and look out the sliding glass door and see nothing but the ocean and having the door open while you sleep, it is just the best! I will always come back to this hotel. I recommend this hotel to everyone. We are planning a small family reunion and I am hoping that we will be able to get everyone up this way and if we do we will be staying at the Paradise Plaza Inn for sure!

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Hector A
Reviews.Content: just returned from staying at the paradise plaza inn at ocean city, md. for 2 days over the memorial day weekend, had a great time, i would recommend this hotel to anybody going to ocean city, the rooms are nice and clean, the beds are comfortable, the front desk personnel are very friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great memorial day weekend”
Reviews.Author: taylorg3
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to vacation at the Paradise Plaza over Memorial Day weekend. We have stayed at the Paradise before, but noticed this time things had been upgraded. The beds were fantastic with new bedding—not like a standard hotel would have but reminded me of a 5 star hotel suite. I enjoyed the complimentary bath and body works toiletries too, (I may have taken quite a few extra home for myself). I have to also comment about a little bar called the tap house directly in the hotel (I think second floor from elevator)—It's our new favorite chill-out bar with live bands. We can always get a seat without being totally crammed shoulder to shoulder like at all the other places in OC. I'll stay again something this summer, can't beat the prime location, friendly staff and comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be happier”
Reviews.Author: Emily K
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at your hotel a couple of weekends ago after not visiting Ocean City for over a year. I wasn't sure where to stay but after reading a few reviews, mostly possitive, I decided to stay with you for the first time. Let me tell you, I couldn't be any more pleased. The staff was extremely friendly and went out of their way to acknowlege us everytime we walked through the lobby. The manager, Tim couldn't be any more pleasant and to go out of his way more than once to address a couple of specific requests was well beyond what we would expect or what we are used to. We loved our room, we loved the view and we will certainly return and we won't wait another year. Thank you for making our weekend one to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite OC hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pmcc44
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to the Paradise Plaza was last year (July 16- 18) and we stayed in an ocean front Jac. room. We loved it. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Our room was neat and clean with easy access to the beach. The location at 9th street and Boardwalk was the best. We are coming back May 11-13 for a little Spring getaway and are staying on one of the Marlin suites. We’ve been coming OC for years and this is our favorite hotel. You can’t beat it for nice rooms, price, cleanliness and location.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: susqmama
Reviews.Content: We went for 2 nights during our Spring Break, and the hotel met our needs. It was clean, and we appreciated the bottled water in our room. We loved being able to see the ocean from our room. The weather had turned so blustery we had little interest in being out on the boardwalk, so it was great to have the view! Negatives were as follows: the note left by the bottles of water indicated we would be left 2 bottles each day, and we weren't. Also, no cups in the bathroom! I asked at the front desk for another pillow, and the young man on duty looked at me fairly blankly...sure enough, no pillow showed up.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: swhit618
Reviews.Content: The location was great and the rooms were clean. The beds were also comfortable. Sadly, the restaurant's grill was broken, which meant a long wait for breakfast (which was good) the first morning and no restaurant the second morning. We also experienced some challenges with the neighbors in the room next to us. It was disappointing that it took numerous tries to reach the front desk staff. However, once we did, the manager responded promptly, took care of the situation and stopped by to assure us that all would be fine. Everyone was very friendly. The managers' special was a great offer that included wine, 2 glasses, and many food vouchers, including one for $40. You couldn't beat the price for this time of year (St. Patrick's Day). We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the rooms and prices. Coming back in a few months!”
Reviews.Author: kalnix
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel as part of a group of 10 families. The staff members involved in the booking process and check in were very helpful, especially GiGi and Denise. I had the opportunity to visit several different rooms while I was there with a group, and they were all very nice and very clean. We had the Dolpin 2 Suite and the layout was perfect and extremely spacious. It was off-season, so the pool was not opened. However it did look very small and it is located in the parking lot, which is less desirable than one that is by the beach. But it personally doesn't bother me that much...I am there to enjoy the beach, not a pool! We are in the process of working with Group Sales dept again to book another block of rooms for June. This hotel is a great value for your money. - A very satisfied, repeat customer

Reviews.Title: “Love our vacations at Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Bobby D
Reviews.Content: Paradise Plaza is at great location 9th street and Boardwalk. Not far from the main area of boardwalk shops and restaurants. We have been staying at Paradise Plaza inn since 2006. The first year we stayed in the "Dolphin" suit it over looked the pool and slight view of the bay. The next visit we stayed on the 4th floor Ocean front, it was great! each time we stayed we had a different room, but really could not complain about any of them. One visit we did call late and were unable to stay in an ocean front room but we stayed in an ocean view room on the north side of the building... Not crazy about this view of the other hotel, side public parking and slight view of the ocean and boardwalk but the rooms are clean and the staff is friendly. The maid service never gave us a problem with our request. We did have one issue with the curtins in one room and the staff came to our room we showed them the issue and with in minutes they were taking the curtins down and informed us they would be replaced by the time we got back from lunch..Extra towels, soap anything you need their staff was always happy to accommodate you in every way. When we return to Ocean City we will be calling and making our reservations here at the Paradise Plaza Inn on 9th and boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Week Revisited”
Reviews.Author: rethlaw
Reviews.Content: I was recently at the Paradise Plaza Inn for a high school reunion. The staff treated us so well. The rooms were clean and exactly as promised. I think we took over the hotel and restaurant for the weekend, but no request was a bother or trivial. I would suggest this hotel to any of my friends. The rooms were spacious. Had a great time and the venue and it's staff contributed to the overall reunion weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Gi-Gi Rocksss, very polite & helpful”
Reviews.Author: C W
Reviews.Content: I just finished a painless reservation process with the front desk my helpers Name was Gi-Gi. Thank you so much for assisting me in my reservations for next month. I didnt feel any pressure or I didnt feel as if i was being rushed. Excellent Customers Service for the Booking aspect. FYI: I will be checking in at the end of April. Stay tuned for part 2 of this review........ Claude

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Wonderful customer service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jen D
Reviews.Content: The manager of this hotel truly understands the importance of making the guests happy and making sure that their stay is all that it can be! We have stayed at the Paradise Plaza Inn many times and kept coming back because the views from the balconies are beautiful and the rooms are great and have jacuzzi tubs. We recently stayed over the long weekend after having not been able to go on a vacation for 6 years. I called the hotel directly and made a reservation and got a premium room on the 8th floor and even got a returning customer discount and saved around $100 for the weekend which was awesome! The first two nights of our stay were not the best because there were technical issues with the jacuzzi tub which was disappointing and they did try to fix but it got to the point that our last day there they moved us to another room which was really nice because it had two balconies, it would have been awesome to have been in that room from the beginning, but we didn't let the issues ruin our trip but it was a little disappointing because every other time we had stayed here the experience was wonderful. After we got home I wrote an email to the manager expressing the disappointment and issues that we experienced during our stay and he has to be the best manager in the world and truly knows the importance of customer service because he absolutely has made things right for us and definitely has a return customer for many more vacations. This hotel is like all the other beach hotels but honestly the customer service is above and beyond at this hotel and I would recommend this hotel to anyone! From a romantic weekend to a family vacation it is just perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Obscured "Ocean Front" view!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy F
Reviews.Content: The Paradise Plaza Inn is a clean hotel with a courteous staff. However, I reserved an "ocean front" room a few weeks in advance during off season, and was greatly disappointed when I was assigned a room on the second floor because my "ocean front" view was obscured by a very large "comfort station" (aka toilets!). The Paradise Plaza Inn should bill these rooms as Ocean View, but certainly not Ocean Front. So while the hotel is very nice, I may not stay there again unless I can be guaranteed a room on the 5th floor or higher.

Reviews.Title: “happy with the hotel and I haven't even stayed yet”
Reviews.Author: Rachel1218
Reviews.Content: I recently called to make reservations for September. I spoke with someone at the counter who was very professional and courteous. I am vacationing this year with a Vietnam Veteran who has multiple injuries from the war and has problems sleeping so I explained to her that his needs are either a hard sofa or a clean floor to sleep on to alleviate the aggravation in his back. She was able to suggest a room that sounds like it will suit all of our needs wonderfully. She even went as far as to explain the different views from the balconies of different floors to determine which would make my vacation even more memorable. It isn’t often these days that you find customer service that is friendly and helpful. Although I have not yet stayed at this hotel, she assured me that the hotel and rooms are in very good condition and that I will be very happy with my stay. After speaking with her, I believe that this will be a wonderful place and I am looking very much forward to spending my vacation here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kevin W
Reviews.Content: This was my second consecutive year staying at PPI. Overall, the stay was nearly perfect. The staff is friendly & very helpful. They cater to your needs the best they can. The location on the boardwalk is perfect. The lobby is very well kept as was my room on a daily basis. The only two issuses I have is the somewhat dirty restroom in the pool area and the 2 fire alarms that went off in the morning the week of my stay (one being Labor Day & the other alarm 2 days later). I understand that things happen that are beyond anyone's control and you also rather be safe than sorry. It was more of an annoyance than anything. Looking forward to year number 3 this summer.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: Sherie C
Reviews.Content: Fabulous! I spent my birthday & Thanksgiving at the beach & couldn't have chosen a better place to stay! The GM was a gracious warm host & made me feel comfortable & welcomed. The staff was courtesy & helpful. The view was spectacular! The sunrise was magnificent & majestic & I saw a large group of dolphins swimming! Just what the doctored ordered:) The Suite was clean and had a huge Jet Jacuzzi, which was so soothing & relaxing. Def, gonna visit again. Can't wait! I would recommend this spot to anyone who wants to enjoy their stay at the beach. Convenient location & views of the beach/ocean are to die for. Thank You Tim Goff for being a Superb GM & having great pride in your hotel. See you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Not so paradise”
Reviews.Author: D M
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Ocean City for the past 20 years and have never dealt with a more incompetent staff. I understand that a request is just that however when the front desk person tells me I cannot have a room on a higher floor because its being held for people coming in on Saturday then I have a problem. Get this it was only Thursday that I was told this. Never have I heard of a hotel operating in such a way. When I as the customer check into a hotel I do not want to be that there are plenty of higher up rooms available but I cannot get one because its being held. These same rooms sat unoccupied until Friday and Saturday evening. Further, my a/c sounded like a jet engine. Incompetent employee number two who was the maintenance man responded, "Well, at least its not as bad as some of the rooms I've visited." I was then told there is nothing he can do about it and he exited the room. No tools in hand and he never even assessed it. Is this proper customer service? Just when you thought it couldn't get worse, my brother dropped money off the balcony and he went to the front desk to ask for assistance in retrieving it and he found the front desk person Morgan sleeping. Another customer was in the lobby irate because he had been calling the front desk for 25 minutes to set up a wake up call. Nobody was answering. Again, this is the first for me seeing a front desk staff sleeping on the job. As for the rooms they need: new beds fresh paint better lighting balcony doors that lock new shower heads carpets balcony chairs

Reviews.Title: “Living in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: NurseDeano
Reviews.Content: Thanks, Paradise Plaza, for a memorable getaway! We enjoyed every second of our short stay and wish we were still savoring the beautiful ocean view and the warm and friendly hospitality of the staff. A special thanks to the General Manager, Mr. Tim Goff, who made sure everything was taken care of for our special reunion celebration. I highly recommend "Paradise"!!

Reviews.Title: “Been visiting for 5 years”
Reviews.Author: Coxki1003
Reviews.Content: I LOVE the Paradise Inn, the location is excellent just GREAT!! an one of the main reasons we stay here, been coming here for 5 years now, we stay for a week not a few days, an would love to continue coming, but my only complaint is that after 5 years you would think that things would change a little, the same curtains, the same lamps, the same bed covers, same shower curtains, an up grade the shower heads!!!!...maybe put table an chairs out on the balcony not just chairs!!...Maybe some NEW PAINT...An the cleaning staff don't speak english ;( very hard to talk to someone when all they is can't speak english....PLEASE I BEG OF YOU PLEASE DO SOME UP GRADES!!!!...I would love to rate Excellent, but not until up grade Kim & Ben Ohio

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: Rod B
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with our stay at the Paradise Plaza Hotel. The location on the Boardwalk is excellent. Tim & his staff went out of their way to make our stay great. Parking was fine & the location of the pool in the parking lot is good as fewer people use it. After checking out several other hotels we would stay there again. My only complaint would be that there isn't king beds available in the ocean front rooms. Rod & Joanie Eldred, PA

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: LTHOUSEAmerica
Reviews.Content: We go to Ocean City, MD every other year and this year we stayed at Paradise Plaza Inn. It's right on the boardwalk at 9th Street. Our room, on the 4th floor, had two queen-sized beds, kitchenette, couch, large bathroom, small table w/two chairs, balcony and a great view of the ocean. Every day you were given two bottles of water, which you really need on those 85-90 degree days. Gigi, Ceaira, Stephanie and everyone else on the staff were great. I would recommend the Paradise Plaza Inn. Nice hotel and Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great boardwalk hotel for a bargain price”
Reviews.Author: Findelyn
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a perfect location, directly on the boardwalk. Do get the end rooms - ours was the 6th floor, a BIG end unit with TWO balconies - one with chairs, the other with lounges. Loved sitting out on the balcony overlooking the boardwalk and seeing the rising moon at night over the ocean, and gorgeous sunrise in the morning. For people watching, this place can't be beat! LARGE clean, comfortable room with a kitchenette, fridge, microwave, complimentary water and coffee, spacious bathroom with jacuzzi bath, very comfortable beds. Their wi-fi stretches all the way to the beach - water's edge!! - so I could email from my chair in the sand. Friendly staff, complimentary newspaper in the morning that we enjoyed while relaxing on our balcony. We left the balcony door open at night to listen to the sounds of the surf which was spectacular. We booked during off season (mid-September) for our anniversary - delighted to find this hotel a bargain at 1/2 the price (!!!) of the other ones on the boardwalk. Absolutely would recommend it for anyone looking for a nice place, on the boardwalk, and centrally located to everything. It is an older hotel, but well maintained and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “First stay in O.C was a NITGHMARE on 9th st.”
Reviews.Author: T L
Reviews.Content: this was our family's first time visiting O.C,we chose paradise hotel cuz location was great,& so we thought the hotel would be the same for the price we paid,we had 2 rms , we were right by the stairs so that made rm on the end of hotel well that was the first problem alls we herd was stair door slamming all night & not too mention the garbage truck @ 6am,rm #2 the air conditioner was not working had to have maintance clean it for it to work,Oh did I mention the fire alam going off @ 2 am & again @ 4 am both times we had to be escorted out the hotel until fireman checked the building mind u there were 3 sm children that we had too drag outta bed just to learn there was a glinch in the alarm system.other than that the staff was somewat friendly & the ocean front view was great,since this was our first stay at paradise inn & our experiance was not the best,my family & I have decided too give it another chance, too show that we are good sports, we will be visiting paradise inn the first wk in Sept,2011 hoping our first experiance will prove us wrong about this hotel....SEE YA SOON O.C

Reviews.Title: “This is a Great place!”
Reviews.Author: sdar4787
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to the Paradise Plaza Inn August 21-26. When we arrived we were 2 hours short of check in, so we left a cell phone number at the front desk to call us when our room was ready and we went and walked on the board walk. 30 mins later we were getting into our room we stayed in room 705 oceanfront on the 7th floor it was beautiful the view was awesome!!! Later that night we put the air conditioner on and for some reason it was making some funky noises lol so the next morning i went down to the front desk and asked if we could some how get in another room the noise was to loud for me. So Gi-Gi at the front desk was more then happy to help (as are all the other girls behind the desk) Gi-Gi hooked us up and put us in room 805 on the 8th floor and let me tell you it was even more AMAZING the room was huge and it had 2 balconys the roof balcony was as big as our room and not only did we have the ocean front but we also had bay front too. We loved it, until hurricane Irene decided to join us.It was the night b4 we were checking out and we were evacuated :( but yet again the front desk impressed us once more, they were calm and collected with telling everyone they needed to get off the island.well see you next year!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The only place we stay!”
Reviews.Author: sally P
Reviews.Content: Where to begin! We have stayed at the Paradise Plaza for YEARS! We love it! The location is great...on the boardwalk, great views, on site restaurant/bar, pool, shops, and the list goes on! The rooms are spacious, I would give you our room number but then more people might learn of the big room! If you have a large family and do not require ocean view, I suggest the Dolphin Suite...it's HUGE! If you prefer the Ocean View, go for a Marlin Suite of the Premium Ocean Front rooms. Both are spacious and offer fabulous views. Now to the staff! Wow! Can you say " like family"?? The staff at Paradise Plaza are friendly, fun, accomodating, respectful, timely, efficient, and basically bend over backwards to make sure your stay is enjoyable. Since we have been staying at the hotel we have seen managers come and go, and I have to say that Tim ( present manager) is probably the most attentive...and he is ALWAYS smiling! Gigi, Denise, Shonda, Stephanie, Sierra, Mo and everyone else at the front desk, and behind the scenes are amazing...always happy to see their guests and always fun! So, needless to say, when we checked out ( just a week ago ), I checked on room availability for the erly fall...I cant wait to go back and see our Ocean City family!

Reviews.Title: “Location location location & a great view”
Reviews.Author: jlepage84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paradise Plaza last week with my husband and will admit I was a bit worried about some of the previous reviews I had read (I'm very picky with hotels and cleanliness). We arrived at 3:00 pm and were told that the room was gauranteed to be ready at 4:00 pm. We had a late lunch at the Taphouse (thanks again to the front desk for the coupon!) which was really good. We came back and checked in and I was really surprised with how big the room was. The bathroom and room were both very clean (the furniture was a little old and the dresser drawers were a bit broken, but we never use that stuff anyway so it wasn't an issue). We had an oceanfront room and the balcony was awesome! The view was fantastic and we spent a lot of time out there when we were at the hotel. The location is absolutely the best! We were right in the middle of everything and didn't use our car once during our 5 day stay. The beach was right outside the door and the public bathrooms were right next to the beach entrance (and were surprisingly clean!). The staff was really great as well and the front desk was always pleasant. They offer maid service from 9:00 - 1:00 and I was a little put off that on 2 different days I left the room at 9:30 and found a sign on the door stating that we had "missed" the maid service. I removed the tag and when I returned later in the day the room had been cleaned. Overall we had a great trip and would stay again. I definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Book this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nickysnan
Reviews.Content: On 8/8 we arrived at the Paradise Plaza Inn for a 5 days stay with our daughter and husband and our grandchildren. The room suppose to be a mini suite, mini was the operative word here. The room was outdated and the furniture old. Later in the day we tried to call the front desk for more towels, which was fruitless, because no one answers the phone, EVER! After going down to the front desk to request more towels, we discovered that there were no light bulbs in any of the lamps, so another trip to the front desk. The real fun started we my husband and I pulled out the sofa bed. The mattress, if you could call it that, slanted on a 90 degree angle that made it impossible to lie on without putting the couch cushions under the mattress at the top to prevent the blood from rushing to your head. The next day when we returned from the beach we found the trash had been emptied and towels left but the room had not been cleaned. This time I asked to speak to a manager at the front desk. An assistant manager presented and I told her for almost $300.00 a night I expected the floor to be vaccumed and the bathroom to be cleaned, also that if she could sleep on the pull out couch I would give her $100.00, otherwise I would appreciate a different mattress. Later in the day the room was cleaned but the mattress never appeared. Even though I consistently asked for additional towels, they were never left and always required a trip to the front desk. The manager called me on Thursday about my complaint, I again mention the pull out sofa, and the fact the my grandson was taken ill during the night and when my daughter tried to reach the front desk for directions to the hospital, no one answered the phone, I also mentioned my other concerns. We continued to sleep on the broken down sofa bed, but my daughter and I took a walk and actually looked at rooms in other hotels for next year. I would not recommend this hotel under any circumstances. Try the Quality Inn, the rate is almost the same and the rooms are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Not What we expected”
Reviews.Author: Amy Z
Reviews.Content: We were very dissapointed in this hotel. It was not at all what it was advedrtised to be. The only thing that we liked was the view of the ocean. The parking lot was not large enough for the hotel, you had to park across and down the street to the overflow parking if you were not lucky enough to get a spot in the lot at the hotel. When we arrived in our room which was ready prior to the 4:00 check in everything looked fine, untill it was time to go to bed. Our sofa bed did not have any blankets or pillows. There were springs missing from the sofabed that made it very uncomfortable. The lamp was broken and missing a light bulb. I went to the front desk at 10:50 pm and asked for blankets and pillows for the sofabed as well as some extra blankets for the kids bed. I was told that someone will bring them to the room shortly. We waited untill 11:30 pm and I again addressed the issues at the front desk. The shifts had changed and it was a different employee, he told me that there was no blanks or pillows available. I informed the employee that it was unacceptable and that I needed the items for my family to sleep. I was told that the empty rooms would be checked for pillows and blankets. We waited untill 12:10 am and I again went to the front desk and there was no one there but a note that said that they would return in 10 minutes. I waited approx 20 minutes and the front desk attendant informed me that he just dropped off pillowes to my room but there is was no blankets available. With some persistence I did get 1 blanket for the sofa bed but not the extra for the kids bed. After talking to the Manager the next day my lamp was repaired but the sofa bed was never fixed. This is a hotel that we will not be returning to. We were not looking for a 5 star hotel but for the price that we paid it was not worth what we recieved .
