Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on 9th Street”
Reviews.Author: Terry H
Reviews.Content: We planned our vacation at Paradise Plaza thinking our previous trouble there was just an error,and they where busy. It all started off with prepaying our deposit for a room on the third floor oceanfront. We arrived early and spent time on the beach. We went for our room and found out we were placed infront of the public restrooms, The floor was filty, the chairs stained, mold in the shower, The deck view was horrible. The Manager was very witty and aerogant, to top it all off they Over charged my credit card, wich emptied our vacation loot, and we had to fall back on other funds til they squared up. We previously stayed in the spring and fall as well as Summer...We will never ever consider going back....MY ADVISE...RUN AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL..The showers are ICE COLD and no hot water when you need it....You can do much better for your Vacation dollar elsewhere, and Avoid the rude daytime desk workers.....Oh and the Internet service never worked..... RUN AWAY FROM THIS PLACE FAST

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Paradise Plaza Inn”
Reviews.Author: MarciaMill
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location is TOPS on vacation! In addition, first and last impressions are memorable. From check-in to check-out, the professional, friendly staff was top-notch. The VIEW is every bit as awesome as everyone talks about, and well worth booking the ocean view. Our spacious room was very bright and airy thanks to the incredible balcony view, clean tile floors, loved the Jacuzzi tub, and especially the makeup mirror and individually wrapped makeup remover towelettes -- nice touch! We stayed here a little over a year ago, and I didn't remember getting those. We also enjoyed the Taphouse Bar and Grill thanks to its renovation, good food and great prices. Even the guys in the Sunsations shop were super nice and friendly, despite it being such a busy weekend. I was quite impressed that even the General Manager was helping guests with check out, and when one party proceeded to throw their luggage from the 5th floor balcony down to the parking lot to save carrying it down the elevator, the General Manager handled the situation with extreme professionalism and composure. On the flip-side, the swimming pool is small and next to the parking lot, but then we went for the beach so we didn't use the pool. Our family will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of both worlds... beach and boardwalk!”
Reviews.Author: Sandy1020
Reviews.Content: We planned to get away for a long fourth of July weekend beach trip, and it could not have been any better! From the beautiful weather, to the location of the hotel, to the location on the Boardwalk, this trip was well worth it!! The kids (5 and 1 years old) loved the beach, and the nightly walks to different restaurants and specialty shops. This was a busy holiday weekend, but it wasn't too crazy! The hotel room was ok, but we were only there to sleep. We chose a partial ocean view, it was cheaper and you could still see the ocean! The bathroom (tub) could have been a bit bigger, but when you're on vacation- you try not to have a care in the world. Upon arriving, we needed a new refridgerator since the one in our room did not close shut. They were very quick with replacing it! The Maintenance guy was super nice and helpful. I went to iron some clothes, but our ironing board was broken. The legs just busted off. Customer service could have been better. Just a bit more friendly at the front desk. Maybe a smile, or a simple hello. It's a little rundown, no air in the hallways or in the elevator. Updates would be ideal for this hotel, considering the location... it could be a goldmine!!! We hope to return again!!!! It was a very memorable family vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic inn and customer service staff”
Reviews.Author: lesliematheny
Reviews.Content: It has been several years since we've stayed at Paradise Plaza and we forgot just how nice of a place it is. Not only are the rooms nice, perfect boardwalk location, but the staff is just a genuine group of friendly faces. The gals at the desk, the security patrols.... all smiling and offering the best hospitality. Of course the restaurant and the shops make for nice conveniences, but the staff at Paradise Plaza made you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: pmcc44
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Paradise Plaza Inn. Great location on the boardwalk nearby to our favorite candy and ice cream store and for people watching. The room was clean and spacious with a great balcony view of the ocean. The jacuzzi and shower (Room 307) were roomy and relaxing Very nice. The hotel staff from the reception to cleaning and maintenance was courteous and accommodating to our needs and concerns. We’ll come back to this great hotel for years to come based on our recent experience on Jun 16 through June 18. ________________________________________

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: clbtam
Reviews.Content: I was very sketchy about staying at this hotel from the negative reviews I saw. The pictures online don't do it any favors either. I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The front desk staff was friendly and check in took about 2 minutes. The room was clean and the air conditioning was on full blast when we arrived. The best part was the view. We had an ocean view room that had a beautiful view of the boardwalk and the ocean from our 5th floor balcony. The hotel is located in the center of the boardwalk. To it's left is nothing more than hotels really but to the right is all the fun. Just a side note and I'm not sure how related the two are but the people at the Sunsations under the hotel were just as great as the hotel itself. I bought beach chairs from them the day we arrived and one broke 10 minutes after buying it. The next day I was just going to purchase another but when they found out what happened, they replaced the chair with no questions asked and threw in a free sunsations bag. I definately will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Some ups, many downs.”
Reviews.Author: JoeyK1
Reviews.Content: I will start off by saying, I am real. I'm not picky, I'm not a person that needs the highest standards in the world to be happy. I don't expect to be treated like I'm the king of the world or anything like that, I'm a guy come on,...however, what I do expect, is to get what I pay for. We paid for an Oceanfront room(507) on the 5th floor. I will tell you my experience as it went. We paid all together around a little under $1000, to say from a thursday to a sunday again like I said on the Oceanfront which is always more expensive, so I wasn't complaining. So we check-in around 3-4pm-ish, and the lady was ultra nice to us, very skinny long haired black lady. Check-in was very easy going, quick and we got 2 room keys(which is all we asked for, you can get more I believe if you want). We used a hotel-truck to get all of our stuff in the room, which was very nice and easy. So we get up to the room, and immediately the view takes your breath away. VERY beautiful view, and then it hits you. Did I really just walk past this ridiculously small room to get to the view? This room honestly barely fitted the 2 queen beds we asked for, with an old style TV(however cable worked, so no complaints there). So 1st negative is how small the room is, especially because we had seen on the site that they have rooms with couches and such. But, we(my wife, son and I) aren't picky, so we were like ehh, no big deal. We had gotten a room with a jacuzzi, which I loved the jacuzzi, my fiance thought it could have been a little bit bigger, but otherwise she had liked it. The bathroom was simple, shower/tub/jacuzzi all in one, sink with nice size mirror, and simple toilet(lol). The room seemed quite clean, however we found a baby bottle under the one bed which did not belong to us at all. I myself hate when room service cleans my room when I'm gone, just a personal preference of mine, so I always put a DO NOT DISTURB sign on the door at all times, even when we aren't there. I know that makes me seem picky, but I promise I'm not, I just don't like my personals around others, especially if I'm not there. So I usually request towels and sheets to be delivered to us via housekeepers, and we just do it up ourselves. The positives I will say are this: The jacuzzi was a decent future, the view is very dreamy/amazing. The exit is through a "Sunsations" store right onto the beach, was cool for us cause we like sunsations. The negatives (read closely, we have a lot more negatives, and this is detailed): Besides from the nice lady at check-in. Every other staff member was not very nice, however this is only from observation as we didn't really interact with them at all, nor did we need to. But we overheard them making fun of some of the guests as they left/walked by. For instance, the day we checked out, I was standing waiting for an elevator to go back up to the room, and the staff/desk workers were laughing that they were gonna tow this womans car that was a guest at the hotel if she didn't move it within 5minutes, as if they were getting some satisfaction out of it. It is one thing to tell someone they need to move their car or they will have to tow it, but it is another thing to just simply make a joke out of her and make her feel like an idiot. My fiance also caught them calling one of the guests crazy, because the guest/lady was simply laughing loudly and jokingly having a good time on her way back up to her room. Another negative would be the ridiculously small room. This is the negative thing that straight P!ssed me off. It was Saturday, my fiance, my son(1yr. old) and myself were beached out for the day(tired of being on the beach for the day) and wanted to still swim, so we decided "hey lets go to the pool" ya know, the pool at the hotel we paid almost $1000 dollars to stay at. We get there around 7:10pm, remind you its a Saturday. The maintenance/pool cleaner/rude old man/terrible worker/find him sitting around randomly throughout the hotel ...guy, simply said to us "POOL IS CLOSED", so I'm like "what?!", I though it closed at 8(even that was early to me), and he doesn't even respond, he just points to a sign that says 10-7, and the times are on a marker board, which they put up pool times I guess everyday. I am sorry, but if I pay that much money, AND you offer your pool as a great reason to come to your hotel, AND its Saturday, AND there is NEVER a lifeguard on duty(that alone I don't understand why you would close your pool at all), with all that, I don't think it should close at 7pm. That was ridiculous, and opened at 10am, so when we got up at 7am, we couldn't even enjoy a fresh jump in the pool. Am I stingy for these simple requests? I mean I'm not asking for tiled floors, or gold painted walls, or not even asking for a simple complimentary breakfast, just usual you would think common things. I would not recommend staying here. To wrap it all up,... not dirty, beautiful view, small rooms, rude staff, sucky pool/hours(very small pool btw, and its located in the parking lot).

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ffdoc2
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location pretty much makes up for any deficiencies it might have. The property is old and could use some renovations but all in all it's well worth the price. We encountered a few glitches, all of which were solved by the helpful and polite staff, however if they hadn't had a free room we'd have been out of luck, since the air conditioning in the first room we had was malfunctioning and the maintenance man explained it was beyond his level of expertise to repair, fortunately they had the same room empty on a different floor and moved us, he front desk mentioning they'd just give that room to someone else. The room was clean, bathroom fixtures dated but clean, rug old but clean, microwave, safe, and refrigerator all working. The ice machine on floors 6 and 7 didn't work, and 5 has none so we had to go to the fourth floor for ice. The elevators were slow, but at that time of year with them busy it seems most every beach resort is that way. Within the same building facing the boardwalk included 3 beach style souvenier shops, a Dairy Queen, and a snack bar similar to the Dairy Queen. A public boardwalk rest room is across the boardwalk adding that convenience when on the beach. Numerous restaurants were within a few blocks. A small but clean pool (roughly 18x36 ft) was on the side away from the boardwalk, parking spots were one to a room but there was plenty of on street parking only two blocks away (on which our car was vandalized however). Again, if you want a solid place to stay in a great location this is a great choice, if you are more into high end amenities then look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good value- Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: loves2read71
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean, comfortable no frills hotel you can't do much better than this. Our family of four (two boys 13 & 15) stayed June 21st-25th. We had a partial ocean view with a nice size balcony. The room was clean and the cleaning staff were thorough. Each night I needed requests for extra sheets/pillows. They arrived in a timely fashion and the staff was kind. Check in and out was easy. Keep in mind that this is not a full service hotel. However, you can tell that pride is taken in this establishment. I constantly saw people cleaning trash from the parking lot or someone polishing the front counter. The only complaint that I could make is that the elevators were busy and often took awhile. That being said- there are two of them and the hotel was sold out. There are other choices that do not have any elevators. Final word- NOT the Hilton- but it was great for its purpose: boardwalk, beach stay, in a quiet comfortable place for a reasonable price. I made it a point to compliment the night manager.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for a family to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Howzaboutstacy
Reviews.Content: We scheduled our vacation starting June 5th not knowing it was Senior's Week. The teenagers were typical teens but the staff kept them in check and it was great seeing them enjoy something that they worked so hard for. We were in a side ocean view room that allowed us to sit on the balcony and watch the ocean but also watch the passers by. The room was spacious, clean and perfect for a family of four. Thank you Eyvonne for taking such great care of us. Our overall stay was great. Most of the staff were very friendly and anxious to help. As others have mentioned, the pool is small as are most of the pools on the boardwalk but it was perfect for our four year old that is scared to get in the water at the beach.

Reviews.Title: “It can't get much better!”
Reviews.Author: jpmaine76
Reviews.Content: Just some of the greatest people you could want to have at your beckon call.. From the Front Desk to house keeping, these people are on the ball.. The staff in the Hotels - Sunsations beach shop go far above to please the consumer.. This Hotel is in the center of the Boardwalk and the hot spot place to stay while at OC... Great private balcony and the room was much more spacious than expected..

Reviews.Title: “Very happy we stayed here”
Reviews.Author: RedCreek
Reviews.Content: This was our first vacation in almost 10 years so we wanted it to be stress free and nice, but we had a limited budget to work with. After reading some reviews here, I was hesitant, but during my research I kept returning to this hotel. We called the hotel rather than using an online service and Gigi was wonderful. From that very first call, through our entire trip to checkout, we felt we were treated as VIPs. Now, please understand, this is an older hotel and there is some wear (like a stained hall carpet - big deal) but the things that counted (the room, cleanliness, comfort, amenities, and staff) were first rate all the way. Our room was fantastic (805) with a deck and a balcony. The floor was tile and it had a small kitchenette. The view couldn't be beat and it was awesome sleeping to the sound of the ocean. The beds were extremely comfortable. The desk staff were very friendly and helpful, giving us advice on local fare, and the maid took extra special care. My question to people who complained about the maids: Do you tip them? or are you miserable and unfriendly yourself? These people were awesome. Parking was fine and the location on the boardwalk was excellent. If your the type to hang out at the pool, choose the ocean instead. I'd say the pools location is it's only big downfall.

Reviews.Title: “Location to boardwalk and view is wonderful. staff and manger very nice.”
Reviews.Author: Kaye1963
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful Easter at Ocean City with family. Stayed at Paradise Plaza and love its location to boardwalk and beach. The staff was very nice and the maids were very accomodating when we needed our daughters room done because she was getting there earlier than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: megankmarcus
Reviews.Content: I was lucky to even book a room (or should I say, rooms, because we had to switch after the first night due to availability) in the middle of the summer for Ocean City. This was the only thing we could afford, and I wasn't really disappointed. Then again, we only stayed for a 2 night weekend trip. I'll rate it in the simplest terms: Pros: The location. It is literally right in front of the beach and not too far from the boardwalk. There's tons of places to eat and things to do around the hotel. The rooms were nicely decorated and had tile floors (a blessing considering the sandy beach right outside) The balcony (definitely get a room with an oceanfront balcony!) Cons: Not much good service (it's pretty much just a place to crash. Stay at the Hilton if you're expecting a place to eat continental breakfast and have room service) It wasn't the cleanest--there was tons of dirt and sand in the pull out bed, causing one of us to sleep on a chair, but besides that it was pretty clean It's not the prettiest hotel. The lobby is nothing but a little room big enough to let people walk through to get to the store (which leads to the beachfront) and a desk. We had a lot of trouble with the room key--it didn't work about 5 or 6 times Overall, if you're just looking for a place to rest your head in between all of your crazy adventures in Ocean City... the Paradise Inn is a cost efficient place to do so. But if you're looking for a hotel geared more toward week-long vacations rather than weekend trips... this isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “A great getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Camper4850
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just wanted a night away from the real world. I booked an oceanfront premium room w/ jaccuzi tub, loved it. Haven't stayed on the boardwalk in over 25 yrs., always camped at Frontier town, but thought it would be fun to stay on the boardwalk. Now we are returning Easter weekend to bring our 2 grandkids down to Ocean City! See you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a night.”
Reviews.Author: jtrav1
Reviews.Content: One of the only hotels that still had a room available for the night during the first weekend in April. Didn't realize that there was a Cheerleading Competition in OC this weekend, or we would have stayed in Rehoboth. That would probably be the reason why the price of the room was also jacked up as high as it was. I didn't really care when I booked it. We just wanted to get away for the night and stay on the boardwalk in a nice room, so the high price didn't phase me at first. Check in went smooth. The front desk attendant was nice and we had no trouble checking in. Went back out to the car to get our bags, walked back into the lobby to a gaggle of screaming tweens (and this was at 10 o'clock at night, we had a very late check in due to work). We were tired and just wanted to go to bed. So after fighting our way through the crowd of screaming tweens AND their parents (BTW...GREAT parenting skills if you happen to read this, crazy cheerleading parents who let your little kids stay up and run the halls of the hotel until past midnight), we make it to the elevator and could hear the screaming all the way up to almost the top floor of the elevator shaft. Get to our room on the 6th floor and finally walk in the door. Room looked good at first glance. Floor was clean, sheets were clean, nice balcony. Then we walked into the bathroom. C'mon, really? I can understand that "sometimes things get overlooked", but how can you "overlook" almost black grouting in the shower? And on the floor? And the mold on the ceiling? That needs to be addressed before someone gets sick. I usually don't get really picky about these things, but for what we paid for ONE night, the room should have been sparkling. But it is what it is, lessons learned. We probably wouldn't stay there again, it wasn't the most awful, but I know we could have saved money and stayed somewhere quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: amylou8994
Reviews.Content: Me and 3 other Female adults over 21 and 2 teenage girls stayed here we had a side room that over looked the ocean and bay the balcony alone was huge... We loved it and will be booking again... The staff was wonderful and so where the guest next to us... Suggestions: I would suggest you bring an airmattress for the sofa bed not the greatest but there kids... A Toaster and a Blender!!! From Pittsburgh, PA

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Emily6549
Reviews.Content: Made a trip to OC in the offseason and decided to change it up by staying at the Paradise Plaza Inn. I was pleasently surprised at what a fantastic hotel it was. When we checked in the staff was friendly and courteous, rooms were large and clean, hotel is right on the boardwalk and the views from the balcony are amazing. One of the best stays I've had in OC, would highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyabable and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: johndcdevine
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Paradise. The staff was very friendly and willing to go the extra mile. Our room was clean and comfortable. Loved the view and being on the boardwalk. The only thing that we wished was that the restaurant was open year-round. We planned a getaway to relax and we were very pleased. We will continue you to visit and recommend the hotel to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be more pleased, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: taylorg3
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this hotel but have been in the lobby a few times before, It looked like renovations had been done since my last visit. The lobby was clean and updated with a flat screen tv, the room where I stayed had top notch updates like 2 plasma tv's, comfortable bedding and a huge jacuzzi tub. I was even impressed with the small things like their bath and body works lotions and soaps. The employees were all super friendly and provided a quick, painless check in/ check out. I would definitely stay again and will book again in the summer when I can enjoy the balcony, pool and prime location to the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: janedoe87
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here as a part of a larger group for a fishing trip. Our room was clean and the staff was very friendly the whole time we were there. The beds were rock hard but that's a preference issue, not a knock against the hotel. It's right on the boardwalk so we walked to most of the stores and restaurants we went to. The only issue we had was parking. Even though it was off season we had to park in the overflow lot the first night we stayed. From then on we parked in the main lot. Overall, we had a great time and will stay there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price”
Reviews.Author: ltritz
Reviews.Content: I tagged along for a couple days in October. My fiance was attending a small conference. The front desk was always pleasant, and greated you as you entered/exited. We were in room #704 (ocean front). Rooms were fine. Free bottled water daily. Only a couple issues with the room and that was the noise with the A/C, but you soon get used to it. the other was that the room key didn't work. They quickly had maintenance come up. They corrected that with showing us to lift the door handle up, instead of down. The restaurant/bar was not opened, which was no big deal, since there are plenty of places to eat. For the two days I was there and considering how cheap the room was, you couldn't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, clean, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaDonuts
Reviews.Content: We believe this hotel has gotten a bad rap. We were seriously considering cancelling our reservations because of negative comments written about this place. Well-were they wrong!! We were on the 4th floor, ocean front, as we had requested. Room was very, very clean. (no mold or other problems as reported by another visitor). Location was excellent. Ate in their restaurant-wonderful food!! We'd stay there again!! Don't let other people's negative comments deter you from staying here - IT WAS GREAT!!

Reviews.Title: “Is this hotel going bankrupt!!”
Reviews.Author: rdduncan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year and all was well. We booked a week long stay for this year and was very disappointed. This stay was part business and part pleasue. They do not give preferred pricing to returning guests as advertised on their website, they do not reserve a specific floor or room for you even though we booked 4 months in advance. You basically get what they have. They did not provide internet access for the whole week we were there, but kept saying it was being fixed. A few employees said it was down for months. They tell you it will be fixed in a day or so, but they really are assuming that you are only going to be there for a day or so, not an entire week. Given that some employees said the internet was down for months, this could probably be a sign that this hotel is not paying its bills. They let us use the conference room on the 3rd floor for internet access, which was a different floor than where we were staying. The internet connection we did get appeared to be from a neighboring hotel. One night while trying to check my business email, the conference room was open and we were told we could not have access to it because the owner had some guests coming in that night. I saw mattresses on the floor and it appeared the guests may be sleeping on floor mattresses. After seeing this, we did not feel very safe in this hotel anymore. I was truly expecting a police raid, or immigration raid to occur at any moment. Bottom line "DON"T STAY HERE". If they go bankrupt, you can get in line with all the other creditors if you want your deposits/payments back.

Reviews.Title: “As usual this place is awsome”
Reviews.Author: Flip1967
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times and is a great place. We like to have an ocean front room so we can leave slider door open and hear the ocean at night. This year I requeted a 4th or 5th floor room and was told they don't assign rooms in advance. On arrival we were placed in room 203, right behind a candy store sign and all we heard was the humming noise all night long from the sign. Very DISAPPOINTED I liked to thisk we pay hgood money for an ocean front room and should be able to request a room location. We are returning guest year after year and should be given that option. Other than that place was clean, staff very friendly and couldn't ask for a better location. Will return next year again and hope we can request which location of a room we want.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel hands down for off-season stays!”
Reviews.Author: fyrnice21
Reviews.Content: My dad,brother and I decided to take a family mini vaca the weekend after thanksgiving last year and chose Paradise to stay at. The name is right on! Although not many people stay in OC during the off season,and we were maybe 3 of 15 staying at the hotel,the service was amazing! Very polite staff and friendly service! They made sure to tell us what was open still for restaurants and even where we could snag a great deal on bike rentals. The room was huge and had a bayside and an oceanfront balcony. Amazing rate for the weekend! We're already planning out next after thanksgiving trip and that's where we'll stay!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally nice & clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lyn60
Reviews.Content: I am late submitting this review but the hotel was so great that I wanted to make sure that I put a review in. We ACTUALLY STAYED AT THIS HOTEL IN AUGUST 2006...not 2009. We had had reservations at the then "being newly remodeled" Breakers. When they did not finish their remodel in time I had to find something else w/less than 2 wks notice. I called this hotel since they were close to where other family was staying on the Boardwalk. They had an opening, gave me a multi-night discount that came out cheaper than what the other hotel would have been. The room was considered Oceanside and we had a small balcony that was great. We could still see the ocean. The room had a small kitchenette with refrigerator, sink, microwave. It came in very handy...we went out and bought stuff to make lunches with to save $$ and had a nice area to fix everything. The bathroom was spacious. The room had plenty of space and the beds were very comfy. MY BIGGEST ISSUE WITH THIS ROOM/HOTEL WAS THAT WHEN WE RETURNED HOME **NOTHING** SMELLED LIKE HOTEL SMELL..if you know what I mean. I don't know their secret but I was truly amazed. The pool was not all that inviting. It was located in the corner of the parking lot. It was OK but not great. They gave you complimentary bottles of water each day and also had the big terry cloth robes to use. The housekeeping staff was very friendly always smiling & speaking to us as we came & went. As stated, we stayed there in 2006. I do not know if it has changed drastically since then as I have not had the occasion to have to stay there again. But from my stay and experience, I would highly reccommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family vacation”
Reviews.Author: sunnydaze01
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Paradise Plaza Inn. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and well taken care of by a wonderful housekeeper. The room was more than we expected. The location was ideal, especially with two small children. The bottled water was an excellent touch. My family would definitely stay again & we will be telling our friends about this inn. Great job.

Reviews.Title: “Rather sleep on the boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: SmittyBelAir
Reviews.Content: We stayed here about 5 years ago and the hotel was really nice, clean, new and well managed. Well, that was 5 years ago and they pretty much haven't done anything to keep the rooms that way. If you don't mind mold on the bathroom wallpaper, shower curtain, etc, this place it for you. We wouldn't let our 4 year old daughter sit on the couch as it looked like its seen one too many drunk parties. Cigarette burns on every flat surface in this non-smoking room. Wireless Internet is not available as advertised. The girl at the front desk said it would be repaired that weekend...but no! What a joke. If you want to stay on the boardwalk, and don't mind "roughing it", this place is fine. Or if you are a group of guys on weekend away from the wives, again fine. If you want to have a relaxing weekend in a nice hotel with a significant other or a family...forget about it. This hotel has potential to be nice again...but right now management doesn't care about maintaining their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet stay.”
Reviews.Author: beachluv07
Reviews.Content: This place had nice amenities and a clean place to enjoy your stay at ocean city. Staff was helpful and friendly and location was great. Opted for a bay side view that was only $10 more than a no-view room, and we had a nice view of the beach in the mornings and evenings. Will stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: tonyfan1420
Reviews.Content: Room was ready before check in. gentleman outside very friendly.Women at check in desk friendly. room very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: rblake1101
Reviews.Content: I enjoy myself every time I Visit, this was the first time I stayed during Summer...The kids had a ball.. The only thing I regret is not having continental breakfast., But that won't keep me away. We have been staying here every November for the past six years.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Steph117
Reviews.Content: The room was perfect for the 6 girls that went on our trip. It was way roomier than I thought it would be. We had a partial view of the ocean and a view of the bay from our two balconies. The views were amazing. Even though the hotel is on 9th street, the walk to get to the inlet was only a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “REALLY DISAPPOINTED & NOT WORTH THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: magsrock
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we had a difficult time getting the keys to work the door properly. There was sand on the tile floors, the lamp by the bed did not work, we pulled the bed out to see if it was pluged in and it wasn't and the floor behind the bed was the dirtiest I have ever seen in a hotel room, it was also attached to an extension cord, not a power strip.Tthere was mold on the wall by the balcony door and peeling paint over the balcony door. The air conditioner was so loud that when it came on it woke us up. The refrigerator did not keep anything cold and sounded like it was about to blow up. The shower was bad, but if you stood still long enough you would get wet. There were quite a few ceiling tiles that needed to be replaced. The bed was ok, not to uncomfortable. We had a good time overall. The employees were nice. The conference room with internet didn't work very well and there was not internet connection in the rooms. We left a day early so we could get some sleep. We did not get the accomadations we thought we were getting for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: Tripplemom
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation for an oceanfront non smoking room. When we arrived we were given a room with a view of the street that smelled like an ashtray. The room was filthy as well as having broken ceiling tiles, holes in the carpeting, and broken furniture. When we addressed our concerns with management, we were told too bad. They said if we didn't like it we could leave because they are fully booked every weekend. We left and got a beautiful, clean, oceanfront room at the Park Place hotel and paid less for it.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed here for last 6 years+ and will continue to stay here”
Reviews.Author: paula621b
Reviews.Content: I WOULD recommend this hotel to anyone. We have enjoyed it every year we have stayed here. Over the years, I have heard people complain about little petty things (a different brand of shampoo other than bath and body). If you are going on vacation and complain over a $1 mini shampoo and conditioner, you better stay at home. Or the elevators are too slow and only one was working. I was there that week and the kitchen had a grease spill. I have a business with a fryer and that grease is nasty to clean up.They had it cleaned the next day with what looked like brand new carpet to me. As far as the elevators being slow, that is a good sign because it means the hotel is busy. If you don't want to wait, take the stairs. It's good exercise. The employees all have wonderful personalities. The rooms have always been clean. I have heard complaints about not being able to check in as soon as you get there but pay attention to your check in time (4:00) and schedule your arrival time accordingly. People usually take their time checking out which is 11 am. If you want in your room at 1:00, tell them not to clean it. That would be kind of gross if you asked me. They are taking the time to get the rooms clean. I must say ours was perfect this year as far as cleanliness. My dad is on his way home from OC right now. I booked a room for him and they said they enjoyed the hotel also. They wouldn't want to stay anywhere else. I have noticed every year I stay my rate seems to get lower. I can't say enough nice things about Paradise Plaza. People just need to look at how busy these hotels are and put yourself in their shoes. I couldn't imagine trying to get everything to suit everyone in a short amount of time and dealing with hundreds of people day in and day out. GREAT JOB PARADISE PLAZA!!!!!!!! SEE YOU NEXT YEAR!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment- not what it appears in pictures on line/ over priced”
Reviews.Author: audrey_boeckle
Reviews.Content: The swimming pool is smaller then most peoples home pool, the pool was dirty and we told them four different times the filtering system was not working. There was a dead bird floating and a lot of hair on the sides of the pool. The rooms were dirty the curtains were torn and hard to close. There was mildew all over the shower curtain. We ask everyday for wash cloths and they kept saying they were out. The resteraunt had been closed and just opened the day we arrived, real dark and was more of a bar instead of a resteraunt.. The ice machine did not work so you would wonder around trying to find one on another floor that did work. The other couple that went with us , was even more disppointed then us , they did not get the balcony that was promised, they were put in a handy cap room , the bathroom sink hung on the wall with no counter to set anything, like your tooth brush and toilet bag. Their curtains were torn as well. The entire vacation was ruined by staying at this hotel for the money we paid. We paid $189.00 per night $60.00 a night would have been about what you got.We had to park our car a block away from the motel because they only had a small parking lot next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money you save!!!”
Reviews.Author: jld1031
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the paradise plaza inn, a week ago. Got a really good deal, I stayed ther even after I read the mixed reviews because It was such a good location and price for not really being in th room much. Honestly I am not a snooty uppity person, but when you spend money on a vacation, especially when a hotel advertises themselves as a "boutique hote" it hard to overlook things. There were 2 elevators, 1 did not work and the other was very slow, parking was a complete joke, plan on parking in the overflow lot accross the street, and good luck getting a luggage cart. The pool, (not that you really need one in ocean city) was decent, just in a weird place... Wireless does not work, and from what I hear I'm not sure it ever does, so If you plan on doing business or using the internet think again. We checked out a day early with no refund because I needed internet for my work. The room was not dirty, not updated like the pictures, but not dirty. Really good spot on the boardwalk, close to everything, we still had good family fun, but the hotel could really use some new management/customer service training and some updates.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Lost!”
Reviews.Author: JamericanFriends
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Paradise Plaza. Obviously in the past it was very nice which is why we returned. The best thing about this hotel is the location. As others have said, there is no getting around the 4pm check in. We arrived at 10am hoping to get in around 1 or 2pm, but no. We had a total of 5 in our group (3 kids ages 8, 6, and an infant). There were 2 towels and 2 washcloths. We did call down for more and they did bring us 2 more of each. They advertise Bath & Body Works toiletries but it is not. We did not have any lotion or soap. Our lock on the safe did not work and the front desk was notified many times. The floor was very dirty and the beds sandy even on the first night. There was mold all around the jacuzzi tub, peeling paint and broken blinds. This room looks like it has seen a few too many parties and management doesn't care anymore. We often smelled pot both on our desks and coming through the air vents. Housekeeping came, but did a poor job. She pulled the blankets up on the beds, but didn't make them. She did not give us clean towels and she balled up the dirty bath mat from the previous night and threw it on the counter. Our trash was also not emptied. We had to complain and the housekeeping manager came in to clean it herself and she did a nice job, but it shouldn't take all of that. I have traveled quite a bit and have never had to complain about housekeeping. There was trash in the hallways throughout most of the day. There were a couple of loud party groups at the hotel and for 2 of the 4 days we often smelled pot. We booked the top of the line jacuzzi room and we did not get our money's worth. It is a great location, but that is all. We will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with many problems!”
Reviews.Author: BeachLover41370
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in OCean City for the past 13 years and always wanted to stay at this hotel. It looked wonderful from the outside, however, the hotel itself is in need of repairs. There was trash laying in the hallways and the carpet did not appear to have been swept the entire time we were there which was a week. We had no washcloths and had to request extra towels several times. Our rooms were not cleaned very well, and from what we could tell, the only thing that housekeeping did was make the beds. The interenet service worked one day while we were there, we had problems with our air conditioner and the toilet ran the entire time. The elevator was stopped for a good while so carpet could be installed which made waiting much longer to get to the lobby. As we were checking out, we heard other patrons complaining about similar issues. We will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad time on beautiful beach”
Reviews.Author: kray19
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing but the service and features were lacking. Called the desk about tv issues and wifi not working but no one helped or cared. Also booked us for two rooms when only wanted one and the hotel said twice when we called that the view would face the ocean but it didn't. Also saw dead bugs on the walls. Gross!!! Never staying there again!!

Reviews.Title: “good time in paradise”
Reviews.Author: Gloria1726
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice, room was clean. Loved the fact that there was no carpet in our room, made it feel a lot cleaner then other hotels I have stayed in. My only complaint is there were not enought carts to haul bags when checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel EVER”
Reviews.Author: amgatta
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews for the places that I stay, but this one was so bad, I had to say something. I went down this past weekend with a group of friends for a bachelorette party. The hotel and room itself were very nice, the location was right on the beach and the balcony was enormous. However the service was the WORST I've ever had - and I've stayed in many hotels. First of all, we only had two towels, which is understandable for the first day. We called down and asked for more on numerous occassions. No one ever came. Our room was never ONCE visited by the cleaning service (though once again, we called numerous times) in the four days that we were there. I personally called down to the front desk four separate times. It was just ridiculous. We had only one roll of toilet paper and two towels for the three days before one of us just took what we needed from a maid's cart we happened to walk by on a different floor. Sad, but true. The internet connection was also not functioning, which I can be understanding about. There are problems beyond their control and I would consider WiFi to be one of them. Still - we were promised the connection would be back in "15 minutes" and it never worked on ONE of the four days we stayed. If they would have just admitted they were having problems with their wireless, I would have been bummed, but not upset like I ended up becoming. And to top it all off, about an hour before check out as we were preparing to leave, the breaker blew out in our room leaving us all with soaking wet hair and no way to use a blowdryer. We called down to alert them to the problem and were told they would send someone to flip the breaker immediately. When we left an hour later, there was still no power in our room. Overall, this was the worst hotel stay I've ever had. And as we were leaving, other stayers were sharing with us similar problems they themselves had with the hotel. The building itself is actually very nice, but with service like that, there are plenty of other nice hotels for the same price that would treat you much better. If you plan on visiting Ocean City (which I recommend, it's an awesome place), definitely skip this hotel and try another.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: jmock3
Reviews.Content: I joined my parents and sister with my 9 year old daughter for the end of their vacation last September. This hotel is nice and clean and right on the beach. Our room was very large with two queen beds in the bedroom area and a couch, which I slept on, in the living area. It also had two balconies. One in the bedroom and one off the living area. My daughter enjoyed changing into her suit and heading straight for the beach. The first thing we did when we arrived at 7:30 pm was walk down to the beach. The staff was very friendly and responded to our requests for more towels and blankets immediately. There is only parking for one vehicle per room in the hotel lot, but there is plenty of free parking right down the street. My daughter and I can't wait to go back to this hotel again this year. We will be celebrating her 10th birthday here, and she is already counting down the days.

Reviews.Title: “not to worry”
Reviews.Author: funfamily53449
Reviews.Content: After we booked our trip I decided to read the reviews. I was so worried that we almost cancelled our trip I am so glad we didn't. The rooms were quite large. We stayed on the 6th floor in the comfort sleep rooms. Beds were very comfortable, location was great. The rooms were clean and there was no mold to be found. Everything worked great and they did have a security bar on the balcony door. A couple of things to keep in mind. If you want a pool this is not the hotel for you to stay at. We can swim back home, we came for the beach so that was not a problem. The restaurant on site was closed but you are steps away from many restaurants on the boardwalk. Balconies are very close to each other,but I didn't expect privacy right on the boardwalk anyways. The one complaint I had is that the rooms had tile floor. Very nice tile, but it was unexpected. If you have small children just learning to walk this could be a problem. It did make the rooms feel cleaner but a little less cozy, hard to keep sand off your feet. The air conditioner was a LITTLE noisy but it drowned out the sounds of the boardwalk at night for my young ones to fall asleep. We have stayed at much nicer hotels but also paid close to $400.00 a night. Great hotel for the price. The reason it is so affordable with such a great location is it gives up things like a pool, restaurant, big lobbies which I wouldn't mind giving up for a better price. We would come back.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: amiricolblue
Reviews.Content: Check in was a mess as they could not find our reservation, even though I called multiple times before the day of my trip to confirm they had everything. The room was big and the view was nice. I did read a lot of reviews on here mentioning mold, I did not see any in our bathroom and our bathroom was well stocked and clean. We had an ocean front room w/ balcony, I will say the balconies need to be cleaned. I did not sit outside on my balcony as it was very dirty and there was a bunch of ants out there eating some food from I guess the folks who had the room before us. I was disappointed to find there were no movie channels available, for a hotel that charges so much this is unacceptable. The pool needed to be cleaned, there was some small debris like sand, leaves etc. plus after getting out I felt slimey. I'm not sure what the bar is like on a busy day but when I went it was only me and my gf in there, the staff was nice though and the drinks were good. The on-site laundry area was nice but it needs to have a coin machine. All in all I would stay here again, its not high end so I wouldn't expect that but for a nice basic getaway it fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Senior Week 09”
Reviews.Author: samanthakozar
Reviews.Content: great place to stay with your friends, on boardwalk, everything is right where you want it, surprisingly the noise from the boardwalk doesn't affect you sleeping, i would totally go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel ABOVE expectations”
Reviews.Author: redsox16
Reviews.Content: hotel was amazing very clean and very friendly staff, and security did an excellent job with keeping people under controlle, however i saw some ppl complaining they got there at 11 and couldnt check in maybe you all should read a little more before you stay because it clearly stats that you can not check in till 4, however when we got there at 9am they took our phone number and called us at noon telling us that we could get in our room that it was ready. also the view on the balcony was amazing, large bathrooms. and rooms. Best place i have ever stayed in ocean city, and it wasnt even the most expensive place, prices are very afforable for what you get, also you have a restarunt in the hotel that has room service and also a dairy queen and candy kitchen and a food place and sunsations right below you very convenient. The only down fall is the pool is not that large but its still nice and you can swim, great for kids though! WE ABSOLUTELY LOVED THIS PLACE.

Reviews.Title: “Not managed well”
Reviews.Author: bleemarvin
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel in March for June 22-25, canceled the reservation May 25th, and rebooked the reservation on June 9th and received a confirmation from the hotel for the rebooking. When we arrived on June 22, we were told we did not have a reservation that it had been canceled on June 14. We did not receive a reason as to why it was canceled, they offered a room that was the top floor with a view of roof tops and parking lots which we refused because we booked ocean front. The room was not very clean and the sofa looked very worn. At no time did a manager come to speak with us, although one female walked through at one point and as we were leaving came and sat behind the front desk but did not address our family. We were the only family in the lobby during this time. We did not feel the hotel was very accommodating and will not return. I am still waiting on my refund that I sent to them in March.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Vacation to the beach.”
Reviews.Author: moranda
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews of the Paradise Plaza Inn, in Ocean City, MD. I feel the need to write one myself. First of all, this place wasn't quite as bad as some of the reviews, I was really skeptical to keep my reservations as most of the reviews I have read were very poor, that is so far from the truth. We arrived at the hotel, was checked in right away and off to our room we went. The staff was very friendly and helpful during our stay. The drawbacks for us was the restaurant in the hotel was closed and the internet was not what we expected, I am a busy person and needed to check my e-mail at least once a day. We did have to go to the conference room to connect to it. The connection was very weak. We would have preferred to be able to connect in the privacy of our room. The maid service is a bit slow, but the room did get cleaned and fresh towels everyday. Our stay was enjoyable. I would recommend this hotel for anyone to stay at. The rooms are nice, affordable and the hotel is in a great location. For the rates this hotel charges. I think we got the best of what we paid for. If you are looking for something more, I would recommend you look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE - FIND SOMEWHERE ELSE...ANYWHERE ELSE!!!”
Reviews.Author: bobo612
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin... First off, we arrived at 11:00 am and they didn't check us in until after 4:00 pm. Found out later our room was actually ready by 10:00 that morning. (Still can't figure that out!) Can't exactly call it clean either as there was hair in our sink and sand in our bed. Nobody at the hotel told us it was "Senior Week" when we booked our reservations. We were on a family vacation and had drunk, annoying, extremely loud, wasted seniors bothering us at all hours of the night. My 11-year-old niece had to hear their disgusting language, watched them groping each other on the beach and boardwalk and witnessed five of them get arrested on drug charges right outside of our hotel. Not to mention that Ocean City is promoting underage drinking. "Beer Bash Senior Week", "Drunk Senior #1 - Drunk Senior #2 - Drunk Senior #3", etc. t-shirts could be found in any souvenir shop. The swimming pool was filthy! It is located behind the hotel in the parking lot beside the dumpster. It was a breeding ground for germs. The "Free Wireless Internet" is a joke...The air conditioning is unbearably loud...The safe had a hole in it with no key and they still attempted to charge us for having it...The front entrance is through a souvenir shop...The maid left only decaf coffee even after I requested regular...We considered ourselves lucky if we got bath towels for the day...Sure, we got the HBO channel but it had no sound. Paradise Plaza's advertisements offer a clock radio with ipod station, bottled water and Bath & Body Works amenities...none of which we got. We didn't even have a remote for the TV! Don't fall for the Bamboo Restaurant & Tiki Bar in the hotel as they have been CLOSED for some time now!?! And if all that isn't enough to send you running to find another hotel...THEY TOWED OUR CAR!!! The license plate was clearly in the hotel computer system. We gave it to the front desk clerk upon arrival. It took us a day and a half to get it returned and they tried to make us pay $215.00 towing fee which we refused because it clearly wasn't our fault. On top of that, we had put our money and other valuables in the car because the safe in the room was not usable!!! The location is good and the rooms are big but it's just not worth it. The only shining stars we found at the Paradise Plaza are their security guards, Tyson & Dixon. They made our stay almost bearable.

Reviews.Title: “Two words-BED BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: TWONBaltimore
Reviews.Content: Dirty bed bug infested hole! I have stayed in Ocean City Hotels that were half the price of this one and they were much cleaner. About a month after I got home I had to exterminate my house for BED BUGS. Yes people they are real! This cost me over $2000. I will never stay here again. The only reason I did was because Park Place Hotel was booked.

Reviews.Title: “OMG....GORGEOUS view & FILTHY rooms! BE Warned.. IF YOU itch!!!”
Reviews.Author: OCEANSGLORY
Reviews.Content: So we booked a weekend stay oceanfront....view was a PERFECT 10 ( Stay on the 5th floor and up if you can) View took our breathe away........! Here's the problem....the rooms are NOT cleaned properly....so if you stay here and start itching...BE WARNED! Our room looked clean to the eye...but the under sheets were stained with BLOOD and other guests were complaining of maids robbing cell phones plus I over heard guests complaining of bugs when we checked out....hence the OMG!.......All I can say is if you stay here...bring your OWN SHEETS and pillows to be safe and DON'T leave your PERSONAL items in your room. (Anything worth $ ) I asked for a FULL REFUND & will NEVER go back....I don't want ANY diseases nor does my family!...Thanks but NO THANKS Paradise Inn and that's my FINAL OFFER!

Reviews.Title: “Our summer getaway”
Reviews.Author: mich74
Reviews.Content: This was our third year in a row at the Paradise Plaza Inn. It is so great because it is right on the boardwalk in a terrific section (9th street). The rooms are very big and many have very large patios with lounge chairs. It is always clean and definitley much cheaper than other hotels on the strip. You even get bathrobes and bottled water in your room. The rooms have a small living room area and a kitchen with mini fridge and microwave. We really enjoy coming here each year. Definitely try out Macky's on the Bay - great food and you can eat right on the beach. We also enjoyed the dinner buffet at Ember's and always have at least one breakfast at the Dough Roller. There's tons and tons of mini golf to choose from so enjoy and walk the long boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “The Paradise Plaza Inn Hotel”
Reviews.Author: T8194
Reviews.Content: I had been looking into traveling to Ocean City, Maryland for a vacation for the last two years just as a place not so far away but far enough for me to drive easly and never got there due to whatever came up. I was reading a promo email I received towards the end of August 2009 and came across some really out of this world rates for the boardwalk hotel. It was heading into the off season and The Paradise Plaza Inn was really wanting to catch peoples eye. I called thinking this was a sham but quickly was greeted by one of the nicest and friendliest voices I had heard in a long time. I was offered a Direct Oceanfront Room with Private Balcony, 2 queen beds, garden tub, water ( 2 bottles a day ) and coffee ( enough for four cups a day ) service every day in the room with the cups/sugars/creamers/ice bucket, 2 terry bath robes, and Bath And Body Works brand bar soap/shampoo/ lotions fresh everyday ( 3 sets each day left in the bathroom) all for the out of this world price of $59.95 a day due to the end of the season. I quickly grabbed it up and then figured out who to fill the space up with as far as friends go. The hotel had 2 rooms left at that point and they were on the smoking floor ( non of us smoke and I was really afraid it would be bad and smell but there was "NOTHING" that even made you think it was a smoking room). In the end, there were 3 of us to share the very large and wonderful room with lots of space left over for even more people if you were traveling with a family ( you could easely fit 3 children in one bed ). The hotel was more then I would have ever thought possable in person when we arrived. It was so easy to find, pleanty of parking with 2 lots but the lot infront of the hotel fills up really fast but they do have a very well lite lot right next to the hotel. I walked into the lobby and was greeted as if I knew them as family. The lobby is very small and can get really crowed in a hurry with the 2 elevators right by the door but the service is wonderful at the desk. We arrived at 2:30 PM and just wanted to see what to expect or maybe fill the time form our 13 hour drive in the hotel restaurant but instead we were offered to go ahead and check in without waiting until 4 PM without even asking. I just mentioned my last name to the desk and was greeted by my first name as if they knew me. We were offered a key card each so we could come and go when we wanted and sent to the elevator. We got off on the 5th floor ( all rooms on the 5th floor are smoking only ) and yes..it did smell of smoke since it was the smoking level but it was clean and neat as could be. My thoughts were still very clouded as to what the room might be like in the smoking section of the hotel and I kept very quiet fearing what I might have gotten us into. We arrived to our door at room 507 and when we opened it, my jaw dropped!!! I was hit right in the face by a view to die for!! From the moment the door swang open you were hit by a wall of glass patio doors at the other end of the room in your direct view facing right into the Atlantic Ocean with nothing in your way but the panes in the glass. It was amazing!! The room was so clean and not even one smell of smoke lingered. The bathroom was so clean and the towels were non stop, the hairdryer on the wall worker like a charm as well. They made sure you never were without. The water was so hot in the shower/tub/sink's that you had to turn it back some. The tile in the bathroom and at the patio doors was so clean and in great condition. The carpeting was very clean and my white socks never got one speck of dirt on them walking in them in the room. The little kitchen area was so well thought out. It had spotless cabnets over and under the counter, a bar sink, coffee maker, waist high fridge/freezer,and microwave mounted under the counter. All in wonderful condition and so very clean. They had 2 terry bath robes hanging in the little open closet above the safe and a really nice iron and ironing board just outside the closet area. The beds were great!! The mattress was just wonderful and the pillows were like clouds. Everything just spotless, in totally great repear, with more then you needed on hand at all times. The balcony was just amazing. We were so lucky to get the room next to the end of the building and the view was just to die for. In the reviews I read already they stated the place was filthy and the balcony a mess but we saw "NOTHING" wrong at any level with our service, room, view, balcony. There were no signs of smoking on our balcony as well. The 2 outdoor chairs were in great shape and repair. They were as comfortable as if you had them in your own backyard. The floor of the balcony was clean and swept. The glass patio doors were spotless from the inside but there is no way at all to keep them totally clean from the outside with the wind, sand, and spray. Anyone that picky should just stay home. The view was so amazing! Our neighbors were just as awe struck as we were on both sides of us. We never go to the restaurant at the hotel or the bar. There was just to much to do and we did not get the chance to see what they looked like. The hotel is in the perfect location. 9th street is right where you want to be on the boardwalk. There are 2 other places to eat under the hotel on the boardwalk and 2 shops selling pretty much anything you might be looking for at really quite nice prices from tee shirts for $3 to surfing stuff. Dairy Queen is one of the eateries and The Alaska Stand is the other with a very nice menu for all three meals of the day and don't forget The Candy Kitchen!! What a treat but I felt it was really high priced. The hotel only has the one way threw it to the beach other then having to go out the front and walk around the corner (which is no big deal ) but you have to walk threw one of the shops to get a direct walk threw the hotel out onto the boardwalk and beach area. The hotel does have a pool in the parking lot but I did not see any signs that it has ever been used in a very long time. It is small and they seem to keep the outdoor chairs stacked up nicely along the back for storage. I would not bother with it when the ocean is so close you could through a rock and hit it from the balcony ( just an idea ). All in all..I am going back next year at the same exact time and really will ask for the same exact room if it is available. October 5th-8th was the right time to go for total relaxation. If you have a family, I would go earlier due to a lot of the places on the boardwalk are in fact closed for the season. But there was not a lot of people to contend with, the places that were open were so friendly and kind, and we got a lot for really good deals too. The hotel was really our main attraction. We sat out on the balcony for hours and just enjoyed the view in the 74 degree weather ( you needed a light jacket in early AM and PM ). We could sit and see 5 or more blocks each direction on the boardwalk. It was totally relaxing and they made us feel right at home. I will be going back to The Paradise Plaza Inn Hotel for many years to come from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Revolting”
Reviews.Author: heatherweh
Reviews.Content: Stinking, moldy, filthy, disgusting. This hotel is old and run-down, it feels moldy and mildewed. We spent much of the trip worried that the place was going to fall down around our ears, that some sort of vermin was going to come out and attack us, or that we were gong to contract some sort of disease or illness. The bathroom had black mold everywhere. Under the sink there was visible dust and spiderwebs. No soap, slow-drain, mold and mildew. No movies available for purchase on the television. Mattress was stained badly, visible all the way onto the boxspring; we are really hoping it was only vomit not something even more noxious. Both mattresses were stained actually, as were the sheets and towels- ewww... Don't go unless you're current on all your vaccines and craving a real adventure. We had an infant and toddler with us and were seriously worried for their safety; we had brought plug covers for the electrical outlets to protect our baby, not necessary since the outlets were mostly broken or missing part of the plates. Other reviewers are right, tearing it down is the only way they are going to improve the place. It is scheduled for renovations but I fear what they will find when they get into the walls and everything. The restaurant/bar there is a pit, but actually had good burgers (I know we were taking our life into our own hands eating there, but it was storming out and we really needed a fortifying beverage). All that said, the view was beautiful, overlooking the ocean, the location was right on the boardwalk walking distance to all the attractions. The swimming pool was closed for the season obviously, but added to the overall haunted hotel effect with murky green water and scum rings. My husband insists I add that "they should be ashamed of themselves".

Reviews.Title: “Weekend of mold, dirty, stinken, hell-hole!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: aviodproblems
Reviews.Content: Can't believe the health dept. hasn't closed them down. They should pay for you to stay to see how a third would country lives!!! A zero.!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will NEVER stay here again”
Reviews.Author: peacefultraveler83
Reviews.Content: We booked an oceanfront room, thinking, in good faith, that it would have a good ocean view. When we checked into our room, we discovered a HUGE pink sign (advertising a business below) obstructing our view. Staff didn't care, and most were quite unpleasant when we asked about switching rooms (we asked very nicely). The manager was very difficult to contact, and when we finally did reach him, was unpleasant and totally uncooperative. Staff made this a nasty place to stay, and pounding loud music in the bar onsite made it impossible to sleep one night into the wee hours of the next morning. Save yourself the trouble and don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “will never return... waste of our money”
Reviews.Author: beckybklyn
Reviews.Content: I booked this room with hesitance, but based on the mixed reviews and special rate listed on their website, I decided to go ahead and make a reservation. Well, this was the biggest waste of our money. Our room was between the laundry and supply room. The side of our door and hallway leading up to our room was blocked by big laundry carts and miscellaneous boxes the whole weekend. The curtains were filthy and my husband had to wipe down the table before we laid any of our belongings on it. Condensation from the air conditioner was dripping onto the carpet, hence the mildew/mold smell. The soft terry cloth robes they advertise were as thin as could be and fraying at the edges. And to top it off, the bathroom towels were stained. We could not wait to leave and never return.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE believe what you read because it's true!!”
Reviews.Author: bairlyangel
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this hell hole. What a joke!! I thought for the money we paid we have a wonderful vacation. My husband , my sister and her husband went. We took her for a special trip. Boy was I ever ashamed that I EVER picked this hotel. DIRTY! Mold in bathroom, sand all over the bathroom floor cigarette burns in the covers, cigaretts butts in the room. Urine stains on the camode. Fire alarm went off and we were told to go outside and wait. No one from the staff let us know what was ,going on. The fire dept had to let us know we could go back in. Next day we went for several hours without water!! Also the sink, shower, were stopped up when we got there but staff said it was due to a busted pipe. The staff was very rude and kept on stating there was nothing they could do. Elevators were awful. Had to wait a long time just for them to work and it even got stuck. The only good thing I can say was we were on the board walk but when you looked outside it was ruined by the plastic chairs, the cigarette butts, and the filthy balcony. Its a shame someone can even rent a room so dirty. Health dept should have been called. Bugs were even in the room. Pool was nasty and the people who were in the pool said they worked there. We were stuck and had to stay wouldn't give us a refund!!

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!”
Reviews.Author: launica808
Reviews.Content: All I have to say is don't bother. I had oceanfront room the chairs on the deck are filthy there is no privacy. The pool is in parking lot. The room itself looks nothing like the photos. Maid service is ok. A lot to be desired. On a scale from 1- 10 I rate it a 2. At least the microwave was clean and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The most disgusting hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: crazydeedee7
Reviews.Content: There were bugs in the room, blood on the sheets, mildew in the bathtubs, crumbs on the floor, dust in the air conditioning, non-smoking roomed stuck like cigars, dirt on the curtains, filthy dollar store chairs on the peeling cement balconies (which overlook the public toilets), no internet service as stated on hotel accommodations, pool in the parking lot (green water and cracked cement), the rudest sand most incompetent staff I have ever encountered. We left the hotel within 1 hour of checking in....I would never recommend this hotel to anyone I loved or cared about....

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DarinK32
Reviews.Content: First I want to say don't be fooled by the pictures on the website. The room is not going to look like that. When we first entered the room the first thing we noticed was that the sofa bed had an enormous rip in the side and multiple old stains. There was also a pair of shoes from a previous hotel guest next to the sofa. When we opened the sofa bed there were old sheets with food particles still inside the sofa bed. This sofa bed was in so poor of condition that the hotel should have trashed it. The extra pillows in the room had pillowcases that were permanently stained. They had been washed but for some reason housekeeping decided to put the stained pillowcases back on the pillows instead of discarding them. The bed comforters were obviously old, overused, and uncomfortable. Sand was on one of the beds, we had to request housekeeping to change all sheets and pillowcases and bring freshly washed comforters. The door to the bathroom makes contact with the toilet which is odd. The bathtub drain was stopped up. The name sign outside the hotel was cracked and the restaurant they advertise on their site was closed for "maintenance", whatever that means. We will never stay at the Paradise Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VACATION”
Reviews.Author: ALEXAKAL
Reviews.Content: Location great, hotel needs repairs, 7th floor ocean view is awesome, view also of the bay. Very hot in the halls with no a/c. the room was clean, a/c worked great but very noisy. bathroom clean, overall great time, wasn't happy with the Management, wouldn't budge on a price for another night, would have been our 8th night between Aug and May of this year. Sunsations is attached and you must walk through to get to the boardwalk, these people are awesome, great prices and great smiles.

Reviews.Title: “i dont know what hotel some of you are staying at....”
Reviews.Author: danielle1201
Reviews.Content: but it's not this place i come to ocean city two or more times a year and everytime i come i stay at the paradise plaza inn and i love it the rooms are clean the beds are wonderful and the staff is fantastic! perfect location being on 9th street i would recommend this hotel any day!

Reviews.Title: “I was robbed!!!”
Reviews.Author: serviceman27
Reviews.Content: Booked through Orbits in Jubne. When I checked in they asked for my card and then proceeded to charge the card AGAIN. Staff would not let me talk to a manager, refused to reverse the charges and then charged me another $200. NO managers on duty whenever I asked to apeak to one. Orbitz tried to fix the problem and is still working on it. THIS PROPERTY SHOULD BE AVOIDED BY EVERYONE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: hotelsucked
Reviews.Content: This hotel sucked. The elevators need to be updated and the maid service can find another job because they have no clue how to clean a room. When I walked in the hotel to check in there was 3 people working they where playing and continued to play while I waited to check in then they acted like I was bothering them. I was never informed that there was off site parking so one night I came in late and had to park across the street which was a inconvenice. They room looks updated on the website but when you get there every peice of metal is rusted and the maid never changed the sheets on the bed it was the worst hotel service I have ever had I would never go back to the hotel I will pay more and stay at a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY and DISHONEST”
Reviews.Author: mandr96
Reviews.Content: I was asked to choose a boardwalk hotel with a great location, reasonable price and ammenities in order to write a review for a travel club. I had narrowed it down to two hotels and ultimately chose this hotel. My first agenda was to ensure that the hotel had a pool, which was confirmed prior to booking the day before arrival. As soon as we entered the parking lot, we noticed that the pool was empty and closed. The registration clerk was rather rude about the situation and refused a refund. They offered the use of a pool quite a distance down the boardwalk., which would be very difficult for someone who is disabled such as I am. The location and view were nice, but the room itself was awful. The sheets were stained and the couch was so old and disgusting, it could not be comfortably utilized. The bathroom was okay except for the mildew on the shower curtain. The doors to the balcony were difficult to use, did not lock for security and worst of all....the curtains were full of black mold (pictures upon request). On our first morning we were looking forward to breakfast via room service from the resturant located in the hotel. They advertise their hours of availability from 7am-2am daily. We called fhe resturant from 7am until 11am (4 hrs) and ot no response. Finaly we called the front desk and were told that they did not plan to open until noon for lunch. Contrary to what they claimed to offer.... there was NO pool and NO breakfast!!! The people at the front desk did not seem to care one bit! I also believe our room was in direct violation of fire codes, as our main door stuck so badly that I was unable to open or close the door without assistance. Had there been a fire....I would have been dead!!! My teenaged daughter even had a very difficult time with the door The icing on the cake was after check-out. My daughter left her bathing suit and other personal items in the bathroom. I called the hotel and was pleasantly surprised to hear that her expensive swimsuit & other had been found. I actually started softening toward them because of their seeming honesty. My daughter had driven back to the eastern shore for something at Salisbury College, so I notified her and had her drive over to Ocean City when she was finished. When she got there, a different clerk told her it was a mistake and nothing was found in or room. I called a bit later to question and again got a different person that seemed to have knowledge of the original transaction. She said she had been told that my daughter had come by and was given her stuff. She said she would talk to hr manager and call back in 5 minutes. When she never called back, I phoned again the next day and sopke directly to the manager. He put me on hold to look into the situation, then had someone else get on the phone to let me knw that he would call back. He has never called. This hotel is very shady at best and I would not recommend it to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location, great memories!”
Reviews.Author: kshilling67
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently had a great stay at Paradise Plaza Inn at 9th and the boardwalk in Ocean City, Maryland. We had good customer service from the hotel staff. Upon our arrival, the room was clean and in order. The location was certainly a bonus! Great family accomodations; we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Definate rebook for next year”
Reviews.Author: bobsnafu
Reviews.Content: The actual features of this hotel as listed were right on par. No surprises and very happy with the spacious accomodations. Oceanfront balconies rommy enough for two to sit and relax and quite obviously enjoy the Ocean views and sun rises. Booked the room to enjoy the cars as they traveled on down the boardwalk......aka....Crusier Weekend. Looking forward to rebooking these accomodations next year in May.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Mike_n_Mark
Reviews.Content: Our experience with the Paradise Plaza Inn was unforgivable. We never would have chosen to stay here on our own given the mixed reviews on Trip Advisor, however we were in town for business and the hotel was paid for by the distribution company putting on a trade show at the convention center. We had an engagment in Baltimore the same night we arrived and had called ahead to make sure that someone would be avaiable to check us in. The lady who answered the phone said that there would be someone there and that she would make them aware that we would be arriving around 1am. We are not sure if that message was ever relayed. When we were a half hour or so from the hotel we called to find out where we should park. There was no answer at the hotel. We called steady, 4 or more times until we arrived at the hotel letting the phone ring dozens of times. No answer. After parking we entered the lobby. There was no clerk and no sign that anyone was there at all. We called the hotel's phone number to make sure it was ringing. It rang over and over again. We talked loudly, said "hello!" over and over with no sign of an employee. We looked around and found a brochure for the hotel and found an 800 number to call. We called this numer and a different phone rang, this one farther back behind the counter. Still no answer. About 20 minutes passed and we decided to yell as our last hope to get the attention of an attendant. "Hello, is there anyone in this joint?!?" at the top of my partners lungs finally did the trick.
