A young man hurried to the counter with blood shot eyes which he was rubbing hard. We said "Taking a nap were we?" in a joking way and received no response. Not "I'm sorry". Nothing. We were so tired, 2am at this point. We went up to our room, on the 5th floor, and found that were were given a room on the smoking floor. Neither of us smoke. If you are a non-smoker (or like one of us a former smoker) you know how offensive the smell is. We didn't have any fight in us an decided to make the best of it and get our 4 hours of sleep. The room was just terrible. The sofa cushions were all stained with huge bloches of who knows what. The refrigerator ran nonstop so we decided to cover up that sound with the fan of the ac which was way too loud. The door into the bathroom had to be forced open because it hit the toilet. The beds were hard, the pillows wafer thin, the sheets and comforter were rough, old and the lowest quality possible. Our sleep was not good, probably a combination of frustration and uncomfortable surroundings. At 6am when we got up we looked down beside the bed, now with more light, and found some potato chips and a pizza crust next to the night stand. We decided to pull out the night stand for the cleaning staff so they could get at the floor better. We checked out, this time the young man at the desk was pleasant and attentive. We did not have time to share our experience with him. If I had children I would never bring them to an establishment like this. Imagine if an emergency had occured and someone needed to contact you while you were staying at this hotel or if you needed assistance yourself while you were staying here. I would never have imagined that a place on the boardwalk would be so bad.

Reviews.Title: “This was the worst hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: mefuller
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online for our honeymoon after visiting the hotels website and seeing all of the pictures. We knew that the hotel was not going to be luxury but we had much higher expectations than what we found.... Upon arriving in Ocean City, we quickly found the hotel but it took us nearly 30min to park do to the fact that the parking lot was being repaired and the open portion was full.... I went to the lobby and asked where we should park and she directed us to a parking lot almost 2 blocks away.... when we finally got into the hotel there were two girls working at the front desk having a personal conversation that acted as though we were bothering them when we asked to be checked in. We reserved the "honeymoon suite" which was supposed to have a jacuzzi tub, kitchenette, bathroom and balcony. When we go to our room after having to share the elevator with two contractors and massive a dumpster. We were greeted by the dirtiest room I have ever seen... The carpeting was filthy and it had obviously not been vacuumed. The ceiling was water stained and sagging, the bathroom was covered with mildew, the shower had not been recently cleaned. In the bedroom it was equally dirty, the bedding was about 20 years old and the sheets were stained, out on the balcony there were cigarette butts in the carpeting and there were not any visual dividers between our space and the next rooms space: not at all private…. we asked the management to see another room, he agreed to show us two more rooms and they were all equally dirty. overall we were completely unsatisfied with this hotel, the "manager" was in street clothes, no tie, just baggy blue jeans, a old tee shirt and sneakers.... He blamed everything on his cleaning staff and agreed that the hotel was misrepresented online. In the end I received a refund, we spent our honeymoon in a very nice room at The Commander hotel down the street....

Reviews.Title: “Undecided!!”
Reviews.Author: Cecil-McDivitt
Reviews.Content: My fiance` and I stayed there the first week on Sept 2008. Considering the location of the Hotel it was great but for the cleaniness it was not so great. The hall floor which I stayed on looked like it needed to be vacuumed. It was very hot in the hall. My room it self was ok. My over all rating on my room was maybe a 4 out of 10. ( 10 being Excellent ) Staff personal was good. My check in and check out was great, no complaints there. My biggest complain was when the fire-alarm went off at like 2am and again at like 4am for the same reason. Other than that it was ok. Not sure if I would stay there again but who knows. If I had to rate the hotel i would give them a 4 out of 10. ( this is just my opinion )

Reviews.Title: “Cheap in Price, Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: welovebeach
Reviews.Content: 23 Year olds with a 1 year old, and Mother In law. This is just for your information- the floor is tile in efforts to keep the room less sandy, from stay to stay, but I don't think it helped. I would have rather had carpet, and then been able to vaccuum the room. We stayed two nights, and the floor wasn't cleaned during our stay. Remember to bring some slippers, socks, sandals to prevent the sand from sticking on your feet. It was generally clean, no random stains, or hair. It was a good price, that's why we stayed there. It was a nice oceanfront room, enough space to stay, and the bathroom was very large. I found the shower pretty gross. The tub was clean but the curtain had a little mildew, and the crack above the shower wall/tub had mildew as well. It was clean for my 1 year old's bath though. Elevators worked well, as did the A/C. We had a stroller and the only inconvience was that to get to the boardwalk and beach you either had to go through the Dairy Queen, which meant you had to climb 3 stairs when the DQ was open. Or you had to go out the front lobby and circle your way around to the ramp. I don't think I would stay here again, but the price was Very Right. PS- we stayed in the middle of the week, and it seemed like nothing was open, everything starts to open Thursday Night. .

Reviews.Title: “A Nightmare I Couldn't Wake up From”
Reviews.Author: CGarv1225
Reviews.Content: The WORST night me and my boyfriend have ever had in our entire 3 year relationship! We live 3 1/2 hrs away and arrived at about 1am. The night clerk told us that the receptionist had booked us in a room that was already taken us so she downgraded us to a room with no balcony. We walk in and the laundry man is sitting on the bed watching tv with a cooler of what appeared to be beer.He started stammering, "oh uh...shes supposed to call me when people are coming up..." and scurried out of the room while gathering up empty cans. That was the only room so we had no choice but to stay there. After we settled in she comes back to tell us that our original room is actually vacant so we then move there. We drift into sleep and the fire alarm starts going off in the entire hotel and everyone evacuated and the fire company came. They let us back in because of a false alarm and we try to go back to sleep again. After another 1/2 hour of sleep we are woken to the alarm once again and the entire building had to evacuate AGAIN. By then it was 4am so we were fed up and packed out bags and left and went to another hotel. We were so upset and riled up that we couldn't sleep there either and figured that our whole upcoming day was ruined because it was 5:30am by then and we had had 1 hour of sleep so we probably would have just been dead at the beach all day, so we just drove back home.7 hrs of driving to go through that nightmare! To top it off I called the manager at 3pm after getting some sleep in my own home and he said he wouldn't refund anyones money becsasue it wasn't his fault if anyone left. So I hope that anyone who is planning on staying there doesn't have a problem because if he wouldn't refund our money for the entire hotel having to be evactuated twice in the middle of the night, chances are he won't refund for anything else. I'm now out $150 for NOTHING. That night has ruined my wanting to ever go back to Ocean City again because I will always be reminded of the horrible nightmare that we couldn't wake up from.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: mkm213
Reviews.Content: Let me just begin by saying...i have never taken time to write a review about a hotel. I dont want anyone to ever waste there money on such a [--] hole. First, room was dirty. There was hair in the tub and the toilet was not cleaned. The very first day we got there...we walked into the room to find no towels...no soap..no toilet paper...no nothing!!!!!!!! I stayed there for 4 days and 3 out of the four days we had to ask for towls and maid service! The maids were completely rude and rolled their eyes when we asked for stuff we should have had in the first place. Oh and just to warn whoever stays here ...if u do decide to stay in this horrbile place make sure u check the sheets before u get in...ours had nasty stains and hair on them. One more thing....we each payed seperately with credit cards..the hotel screwed up really bad and didnt charge the right amount on our cards. They over charged us quite a bit. I had to call 4 times to get it straightened out. PS. forget about finding a parking spot if u get there past noon. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: karatekat22000
Reviews.Content: i didnt plan to stay here but i am glad I did i resevered another hotel but they screwed up real bad and my family was stranded, i walked over to the plaza and they were more than happy to help me i booked a suite for two nights and the stay was great the master room had a view of the ocean the living room had a side view, the guest were great along with the staff if I had more time i would of stood longer, i am looking foward to spending more time there

Reviews.Title: “Dirty! Save your money and stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: jesmorgan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paradise Plaza 8/9/08-8/13/08. I was apprehensive based on the reviews, but my sister had already reserved the room so there was nothing we could do. We paid almost $300 per night for an ocean front room. This was probably $200 per night more than it was worth. Granted, the hotel is in a great location, but as stated by other travelers, it was dirty and the hotel staff did not care. First, we were not able to check in until 4pm. I understand during the busy summer months that hotel rooms turn over rapidly and need to be cleaned. However, our room only had the beds made and towels changed, so I am not sure what took them 5 hours! Upon checking in, we noticed the room was dirty. The sofa/sofa bed was so stained that we put a clean sheet over it before sitting on it. The sliding glass door looked like every person in a 5 mile radius had smeared his/her hands all over the glass. The sliding door itself was broken so if you went on the balcony and shut the door, you locked yourself out. The draped were tattered. The tile floor had been swept/vacuumed, but not mopped. Don’t look behind the bed; there are dust bunnies, hair, debris, etc. Clearly, no one has ever pulled the bed out and vacuumed the floor under it. Overall the room just looked dingy. Upon further inspection, we found remnants of soap in the shower from previous guests. The toilet paper spool broke off each time we used the toilet paper. The two “spa robes” that they provided were just terry robes which were dingy and worn. (The notice hanging with the robes offered that you could purchase the robe for $45!) The worst part came when we got in bed at 11:30pm. My bed had sand it – and we had not yet been to the beach! I called the front desk to ask them to send up clean sheets, telling her there was sand in the bed. Her reply was, “Oh, they must not have changed the sheets.” Gross! I can live with the other problems, but not changing the sheets between guests is unconscionable. The next morning we saw the housekeeping staff in the hall outside our room. They were sitting on the floor talking. When we told them about the dirty sheets and asked for clean towels, it was evident that they did not care at all about the cleanliness of the room. It’s a shame that this hotel is in such disrepair because it has a lot of potential and is situated in an ideal location. With a little TLC, the Paradise Plaza could be a great place to stay for a beach vacation. There are many other hotels in OC that are cleaner and/or less expensive. I would not stay at this hotel again and would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Rickydogg
Reviews.Content: My family had a great stay at the Paradise Plaza. Couldn't beat the price for ocean front, boardwalk hotels. The room was clean, and the service from hotel staff was outstanding. We did have a toilet flushing problem when we first got there, but the staff was very quick at attemping to correct the problem. We probably could have gotten a new room if we pressed the issue, but the room was so good, that we couldn't give it up (Rm. 810). The problem was eventually corrected. Who knows what crazy things people flush down a toilet. It was a side-facing view with a giant balcony. Two chairs, and two chaise lounges, and there was still room to dance. You had a view of the ocean and the bay. The only real complaint that we have, is that the elevator was really slow. The front door took forever to close, which I think was the problem. Also, hotel staff used it a lot to go from one floor to another. We would stay there again in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and very deceiving”
Reviews.Author: traveling_md_mom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paradise Plaza the weekend of July 25th. From the moment I walked in the lobby I was upset. It's a complete eyesore. The staff was less than professional. My oceanfront premium room was a complete disappointment. The furniture was worn and some rusted. The linen had grit on it (I suspected it to be sand) and I paid $300+ for this room. Management did address my complaints to a certain degree but it was still less than satisfactory. As others have stated, the hallways are uncomfortable, the pool is very small and in the parking lot, and there is no privacy whatsoever on the balcony. I visit Ocean City each summer and always stay at one particular hotel. I waited too long to reserve my room this year and had to try another place. Let's just say I will definitely be sure to book my "preferred" hotel well in advance from now on because I will never stay at Paradise Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine... but not finely perfect”
Reviews.Author: bustertheboa
Reviews.Content: I can see -- with emphasis on CAN -- why some people would be critical of this hotel. It is a bit worn and could use a facelift. Everywhere you look there are signs of gradual and minor delapidation: small pieces of peeling paint and wallpaper, a ceramic tile that is cracked, shower curtains with flecks of mold, an ironing board that is obviously very used, lamp shades with smudges and breaks, worn carpeting, patio furniture that is a bit dirty (although white resin/plastic furniture does tend to get dirty), bath tubs that have obvious caulking repairs, dirty ceiling tiles, furniture of the laminate/veneer variety -- that have pieces of laminate/veneer peeling or chipped off, etc., etc., etc. The pool is small and seems to have been put in as an after thought. It is in the parking lot next to a dumpster, taking away valuable and much needed parking spaces. The hours seemed short to me, only open 10 am to 7 pm. That having been said, there was a restroom dedicated to the pool -- very convenient -- and the water itself was perfectly clean and comfortable in temperature. There was no odor in spite of being next to a dumpster (a wall did separate the pool from the dumpster). Towels were provided, there were ample lounge chairs, and the children definitely liked the pool. The pool was only 4 feet deep at its deepest, whereas I generally prefer up to 5 or 5-1/2 feet. The lobby is small and the hallways are somewhat hot, albeit perfectly tolerable. It certainly was not stifling, and I noticed no odor, contrary to what some have reported. There are only 2 elevators and only 4 luggage carts. Parking is difficult, but only if you insist on parking in the hotel lot. There is overflow parking across the street that is ample. No big deal in my opinion, but apparently it is to some. The TVs are relatively small at 25", and are of the older tube variety with bubble screens. The FREE highspeed internet connection was fairly slow with wireless. I never got above 11 mb/second. The hard connection ethernet port was not working. The air conditioner is noisy. So all of the criticisms I have read are legitimate. I can understand them, and I don't disagree with them on a purely factual and descriptive basis. But all that having been said, I honestly feel that many have been OVERLY and NEEDELESSLY critical of the Paradise Plaza. It's a beachfront hotel folks -- NOT the Hilton or Marriott in a major city next to a large convention center. Obviously the decor and upkeep will be different. Expectations need to be realistic. I found the Paradise Plaza to do a perfecty fine hotel. It was as clean as I would expect a beachfront hotel to be during peak tourist season. The room was VERY spacious and comfortable. We did not need the AC at night, even though it was July. So the AC being noisy was a non-issue. The maid service was fine. We had two light bulbs burned out, and they were replaced -- literally -- within a minute. A maintenance person came up immediately to check on the ethernet port when I called down. I would have thought such to be low priority, but they responded with great alacrity. Towels, which were clean and fresh, in contrast to what others have reported, were provided daily; although I did notice that the trash was not always emptied. We got a very nice suite for $265 (total for the Dolphin Suite, various taxes, miscellaneous fees). That got us a large suite with two bedrooms, two full baths, two additional sinks, two balconies, two TVs, two full size closets, a mini fridge, a microwave, three queen beds (all with very comfortable mattresses), and a queen size sofa bed. With an Aerobed on the sleeper sofa, it was also very comfortable. Our neighbors were young adults/teenagers, and they tended to stay up late with "louder than ideal" music. But obviously that is not the fault of the hotel. People complain about having to walk around the hotel a couple of dozen yards, or through the Dairy Queen or Sunsations Shop, to get to the Boardwalk. No big deal in my opinion. If I had not read some people complain about such, it would have never even occurred to me to mention it. The hotel has a primo location on the Boardwalk. I honestly do not see that the hotel was anything to castigate or berate as some have done so scathingly. Yes... there were things that could be improved. Yes... the hotel is showing its age and has some wear and tear. But given the price, the Paradise Plaza was substantially better than I expected -- particularly given the negative reviews I had read. I would stay there again myself without hesitation, but would only recommend it to others with the above caveats. Overall grade... B/B+.

Reviews.Title: “Big Expensive Disappointment!!!!”
Reviews.Author: boardwalkgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paradise Plaza July 24th thru July 28th. We had children with us so we chose to drive thru the night, knowing we would be too early to check-in. The hotel stated that there were changing facilities available so we thought we would spend the time at the beach. Well the "changing facilities" turned out to be a very small bathroom with a toilet and a sink. Not where you would want to change after being at the beach and have to drive several hours back home. There was no shower in the bathroom. Even though the area where this bathroom was located was totally filthy, we were still hoping that once we got to our room it would be much better. This was not the case. The hallways were extremely hot!! The elevator was so slow and took forever to come. Not only that, these are the same two elevators that the hotel staff had to use. You would think that being an employee you would let the paying guests get on the elevators first, this did not happen on several occasions. Our balcony door was nearly impossible to slide open. It was broken or off the track or something. It made it a real inconvenience to step outside on the balcony. And as for "private" balconies, they are not, you are directly next to the room next door. We had a total of 5 people staying in our room. Each and every day we had to call down for extra towels or stop at the front desk to pick them up. We also ran out of toilet paper at one time and had to call for an extra roll because there was none provided. The hotel advertises an in room safe that we did not have a key for. We called right away and several other times, to get a key but never received one the entire time we were there. If they did not exist we should have been told that up front. The access to the beach should not be stated as it is. You have to go thru either the Dairy Queen or a Sunsations store to get to the beach. Or you can go out the front door and around the building. None of those is direct access. As for the cleaning service, they came in made the beds and emptied the garbage. That's it!! They did not clean the bathroom nor did they run the sweeper. For nearly 300.00 a night I really want to know what I was paying for. Over-all I was very disappointed with this hotel. I feel it was definitely not worth the amount of money we paid for a 4 night stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Last trip to Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Disney-Addict1208
Reviews.Content: Just back from the Paradise Plaza Inn. I had planned a girls weekend with my mother and two daughters. It didn't turn out quite the way we had planned it. When we arrived in our rooms we soon realized that our room was not stocked with anything. We did not have any toilet paper, soap or coffee (although there was a coffee pot). I called down to the main desk and the gentleman that answered the phone told me that he had all these things at the front desk, but that I needed to go down to retrieve them due to the fact that he was the only one there and he was "dealing with the police". Around nine thirty in the evening, there was a loud banging on our neighbors door that lasted at least fifteen minutes. Spent Saturday on the beach, which was heaven. If I hadn't passed housekeeping on my way to my room, I would have sworn they hadn't been there. The beds had been made, but that was it. The bathroom still had mold all throught the tub, etc. It was really disgusting. Later in the evening three of us were sitting out on our balcony when ice cold water was dumped all over us from the balcony above ours. I called down to the front desk yet again. They did send security up to our room and after checking out our drenched balcony said that they would take care of it. As others have mentioned in their reviews the hallways are extremely hot, there is no air conditioning in the hallways. I've never gone away for a weekend where I was so happy for that weekend to end. So much for a wonderful girls weekend at ocean city.

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: ttoothfary
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay at Paradise Plaza online and was alittle concerned because of the negative reviews that I had seen. I booked it way in advance and because of that I got a very good rate especially for 4th of July weekend, so that made me even more concerned about the quality of this hotel. We were pleasantly surprised to find out this hotel was just fine. The location was great! The hotel and our room were clean and in good condition. The staff was very friendly and efficient. We really did'nt have any complaints. We have been to Ocean city ,MD. many times and have stayed in many hotels, so we do have alot to compare it too. The only thing I did notice that I did'nt like was that there were cigerette butts on the balcony. I even picked them up with a tissue on our first day there, but in the morning there were more. It does get windy so I imagine they blew onto our balcony from someone above us. There's not much that they can do about that , but they should have the cleaning staff clean the balconies everyday, besides that it is a great hotel and you can't go wrong for the price! Unless you are expecting the Hilton, you will be happy with this hotel and if you are expecting the Hilton you should book your stay at the Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Bruz123
Reviews.Content: Hotel was much better that I expected from reading previous reviews. It was as clean as can be expected for a beach front hotel. The room was very spacious and comfortable. The hotel is a little on the worn side but not bad at all. Remember this is a beach and not a major city so I'm sure things get a little run down as the season progresses. Don't expect an early check in and if you find a parking place don't give it up. There is more parking across the street but I would't think it was as secure. Most of the internet prices were pretty high but we made them through Travelocity and got them for half of the other advertised prices. I was afraid we would be in the basement but had oceanfront balcony rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible.Nasty.Dirty.Rude.Will never ever stay again!”
Reviews.Author: bink15
Reviews.Content: Let's start from the beginning. Waited long to check in. Could not find a luggage cart. Hallways were about 108 degrees and filthy. The smell as soon as we opened our door could have knocked you out. I used up a bottle of air freshener! The bathroom was NASTY!!! There were long black hairs stuck to the walls!! Take my advise, were your shoes at all times!!! The beds were hard & uncomfortable with flat pillows. The air conditioning was cold but so loud it woke you up out of a sound sleep all night long as it kicked on & off. The balcony was never cleaned. There were cigarette butts and garbage everywhere!! This was supposed to be a nonsmoking room. On our second day, the elevator was down for servicing. This meant a 15 minute wait for the only other elevator. The one day we went to use the pool, I stopped my daughter from going in because of the white goo floating around the sides.(you could use your imagination. I should have known on the way down she noticed deflated "balloons" in the hallway!!!!) Next time I will spend the extra money and stay at the Holiday Inn & Suites like we previously did. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: irishbob77
Reviews.Content: Great oceanfront view and great location. Everything else was pretty bad. The bathroom was dirty, and the balcony was really bad. The glass door looked like it had never been cleaned. There were cig. butts and beer cans. You couldn't even sit on the patio furniture because it was so dirty. The rug turned your socks black and the heater/AC unit is really loud. Also, the restaurant in the hotel was closed even though when making the reservation I was told it was open. Okay place to stay with friends to party at the beach. Not so much for couples, families or special occasions.

Reviews.Title: “broken promises and liars”
Reviews.Author: jmsiii
Reviews.Content: I saw a add in the paper for $199 deal weekend stay included in the deal was suppossed to be a $40 voucher for a restuarant,$20 gas card for wawa and 2 comp glasses of champagne when I checked in they didn't mention the deal when I asked about this they told me I was not elegable to the deal because I didn't mention it to them although I received the rate and a beachfront room they even had the deal on the elavator door The room was nice & a good view The following year when we tried to rent the room they had the same add in the paper but when I called they jacked the price up because it was going to be a niceweekend

Reviews.Title: “Just took a walk-thru”
Reviews.Author: xojessicann
Reviews.Content: We drove from Baltimore MD down to the ocean (on a sat.) to check out this hotel. we had scheduled a walk thru to see there banquit room for a wedding reception.Then there rooms and suits for us and our family's to stay in. Well when we arrived, they were not ready for us. the managament was suppose to walk us through. they all took off that day and the head cleaning guy had to gives us our tour. which he didnt say one word. he took us to the "honeymoon" (premire room)suite first. the hallways smelled badly of chemicals. the room had a jacuzzi. however i didnt inspect it for cleanlyness. the room however was dirty.the nice pictures they show you in the brochure is nothing like the real thing. yes it had the pillow top mattres and nice pillows, but there tv was an old raty thing that was on a old broken desk thing. the bathroom was dirty and was not nice looking like they said it was after being :"renovated". there was crushed beer cans on the balcony which faced other buildings. then we saw a standard room. again the hallways stunk. the bottom of the door looked like someone had a fit and kicked the door in! the couch in there was ripped up and taped. the bedding looked dirty, the tile looked dirty and the bathroom was gross. again the tv and desk was old and worn. then we headed to the "banquit" room.First we were told that the meeting/banquit room held up to 75 people comfortably. We only had 57 people all together that would be in that room. when we walked in my jaw dropped, it was the tiniest room that would fit maybe 35-40 people with no breathign room. there were only 3 tables in there and it took up half the room. there was a little tv in there and had 2 newley renovated bathrooms. they were the only good part of this room. i wonder what happened to the suite bathrooms. that whole place was a waste of time. untill we went up to meet the owner of the brand new reastrunt Bamboo. that is the only reason i would step foot into that hotel. we went to talk to him about catering and found out we can have the reception there it was bigger and inexpensive. that place is the coolest place. i was ready to ask if i could bunk up on one of the tables cuz that would be much better then any of the rooms there. so needless to say we are having our event at Bamboo and are very pleased with that, however we have already booked a room at another hotel a few blocks away! the paradise plaza is a complete waste of money! the way it was kept in the off-season is horrible. i'd hate to see it when there are people constantly in and out and they have only so much time to take care of things.

Reviews.Title: “A little concerned about this place”
Reviews.Author: pfizer6
Reviews.Content: I didn't get the room that I was promised. When I told them about the problem, they didn't seem very concerned. A matter of fact, I had to yell at a guy that was doing laughing gestures behind the manager's back. It's a nice hotel, but when they didn't keep their promise to me. I was very angry on my 1st day of vacation.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms,great location”
Reviews.Author: orangemen92
Reviews.Content: The location of hotel was ideal. Just park and everything was at your finger tips. We just walked to the beach which was within 50 yards away.rooms were spacious and we really enjoyed the terry bath robes, bottled water, and the Bath and Body works soaps. Looking forward to a future stay and trying their new premium sleep room,next time with a jacuzzi. thank you staff as you made our cruisers weekend lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had heeded the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: WearyTraveler911
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel for its proximity to our ultimate destination. I had read the bad and good reviews and couldn't understand how there could be such a difference between the two and decided that the people who wrote the bad reviews must have been extremely picky. How wrong was I!!! The hotel boasted direct access to the beach through a business connected to the hotel. This business was closed so access was out the front door and around the building. No big deal, but not what was advertised. The hotel boasted a "very good" restaurant. This restaurant was closed. A notice was in the lobby dated 8/16/07 that the restaurant would be closed for two weeks. It was still closed as of September 30th. Again, not as advertised. From previous reviews, some subjects stated that the hallways were dirty and not climate controlled. TRUE! Thankfully, it was not very hot on the days we were there. I could not imagine staying at this hotel during the middle of summer. As for the room...we booked a non-smoking room. When we first entered the room, the odor of cigarette smoke was very strong. The night stand was also covered in cigarette burns. There was also a medium sized stain on the floor that looked like blood but who knows what that was. I immediately returned to the front desk and they gave us a new room (right next door). This room didn't smell as bad, but still had cigarette burns on the night stand. To me cleanliness of the room was an issue. The air conditioning return and vent were covered in a very thick layer of dust. The dust had blown onto the ceiling of the room so it looked like there had been a fire. There was also so much dust on the heat light in the very small bathroom that we wouldn't use it for fear it would catch on fire. There were also what looked to be grease type marks on the sheets, pillow cases and towels. The hotel website lists a pool which they do have but it is small and in the parking lot which is in the front of the hotel. The hotel website says that the hotel was renovated in 2006 but you could not tell it by our room. The beds were very uncomfortable and the bathroom was in need of repair. One plus for the hotel, we couldn't hear the people in the rooms next to us. Both rooms were occupied by families with children. We couldn't hear them, but we could hear when the air conditioners started in each room. Units were VERY loud. Please take the negative reviews seriously. I wish we had. :(

Reviews.Title: “Had the best time ever!”
Reviews.Author: Beach_Lover_13730
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a four night stay that was perfect in every way. We had a clean, spacious oceanfront room on the third floor. The weather was beautiful. The views from our balcony were spectacular, especially the sunrise and the full moon shining on the water. We saw dolphins swim by every morning. It's also a great place to people watch. We didn't have any of the problems that other reviewers on this site mentioned; maybe we were just lucky. We'll definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: runrzwife
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last November and made a great choice! This was our first trip to OC and we loved everything about it. The hotel is right on the Boardwalk with tons of places to eat and shop. Check in was a breeze; the room was clean and big. We had an oceanfront room which was great for just people watching. Only thing I would change would be requesting a room higher up (we were on the 3rd floor) because we could hear a lot of people on the Boardwalk at night. We went during the off season so there were no crowds at all. Perfect timing! Will definitely return to OC and the Paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: rodz51
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. They have parking on the next block and it appeared to be safe and some what convient. The lobby and hallways were clean but not much else. The room was large enough but the bathroom had a "#2" in the toilet. The floor was clean but the bed wasn't. 2 of the 4 pillows had stains on them that the cleaning staff couldn't have possibly missed. The sheets had a couple hairs on it. The balcony was nasty! It had outdoor carpet that was wet, moldy and stained. It looked like it had been there for 20 years. The white plastic lounge chairs have never been cleaned. There were cigarette butts all over. I guess the cleaning staff doesn't have to clean outside. We are not picky or snooty like some people sound on these posts. We didn't complain because we were staying only one night. I would not have stayed more than one night. I would not recommend this hotel unless you got a really really good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Location=Great/Hotel Cleanliness=Awful!”
Reviews.Author: cebers01
Reviews.Content: Folks, the hotel is in a great spot on the boardwalk, but we WILL NOT stay there again... Here is what we found last weekend. 1. At check in, the hotel looks fine, although a little beat up in the lobby area, bbut it's a beach hotel, so we gave it a pass. The staff at the front desk was young, and that theme stayed throughout... They weren't too engaged in what was going on, but got us checked in, so up to 8th floor we went to our Premium room w/jacuzzi. 2. In the door, and the first thing you noticed was the whole room is tiled... It's cool, the AC works fine, but the fridge was pretty pungent. But was we walked on the tile, it's already dirty... and we just got here! Ok, so next time, if you get the tiled floor room, bring your own broom! 3. But then... check out the bathroom. Yikes!!! See the photos and judge for yourself... Don't look behind the shower curtain...Don't look at the jacuzzi tub... Don't look behind the toilet! Finally, don't even look up at the ceiling! Scunge around the john, a whole lab full of junk browing behind the shower curtain, and hairs plastered to the ceiling!!! Yuck!! You can't sit in the tub, and you could smell the must growing... So bring your own Tilex too... 4. So after we saw all that, we asked the front desk what could be done, and asked to have the manager call us on our cell. Never got that call, although they did have staff come up to the room, they didn't manage to actually CLEAN THE BATHROOM! 5. Since we have already paid over 300 a night for the room, we had committed to stay. But you could easily pay half that for a dirty room in OC... We spent most of the night on the balcony, which was the only saving grace of the place. In conclusion... We didn't spend much time in the room, which is what most people do at the beach anyway right? But you just didn't want to spend a second more than you needed to in the bathroom. We never heard from management about addressing the room... But worst of all, THEY ACTUALLY LOOKED WHAT WE SHOWED THEM AND THEY STILL DIDN'T CLEAN IT! So buyer beware... Other have had better experiences here, but we've personally never had worse!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, So-So Hotel”
Reviews.Author: T13
Reviews.Content: Well I certainly didn't find it as terrible as some of the other reviewers but it definitely had its issues. I'll start with the positive... The location was wonderful, right on the boardwalk in the middle, convenient to just about everything- restaurants, beach, amusement park, shops, etc. There was also a Dairy Queen connected to the hotel which came in very handy. The room was a decent size, with Bath & Body Works toiletries, comfy bathrobes, and bottled water supplied daily. The maid service was adequate and timely- had no problem with it at all. Also, we requested adjacent rooms upon check-in and they were able to provide that with no problem. Now for the down side... The hotel could definitely use an overhaul. In fact, I actually cut my arm pretty bad as I rushed past the DQ hot dog statue outside the hotel because it was broken and had a jagged edge exposed. The balconies should also be re-done as they are very worn down and dirty and the carpet on them is ripping apart. The pool is very small but honestly so was just about every other hotel pool we saw on the boardwalk. It was sufficient for our kids. But the pool is located in the parking lot so it's a little awkward. They advertise Pay-per-View TV in their brochure but no longer have it available. And lastly, the BAR in the hotel has no liquor license if you can believe that! We attempted to go to the buffet in this same bar/restaurant for breakfast but quickly did an about-face when we saw all the flies circling the food. I would definitely get your food elsewhere if you stay in this hotel. Overall, it was an ok choice if you are mainly concerned about just having a decent place to sleep at a super location.

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: llovingyou826
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here in april and we thought it was very nice. The room we had, had 2 beds, and a jacuzzi. The room was perfect size, we had a lot of space. The balcony was very spacious too. We had a side view of the ocean, which was very nice because we could see a lot of the ocean, and also the bayside, which was nice because we got to see a very nice sunset from the bayside. The room was very clean, and so was the bathroom. The counter around the sink was very big, and i could fit all my stuff up on it which is always nice. The only thing they could change would be the carpet on the porch, it had a lot of holes on it. But i would definatly stay here again and would recommend it to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: readingqueen
Reviews.Content: We reserved 2 rooms for last week. The rooms were filthy. On Saturday afternoon my daughter could smell marijuana smoke coming into the vents in her 8th floor room. Her bathroom was filthy. Hallway never vacuumed and food thrown all over the place. Our room was on the sixth floor. Our towels were filthy and had hair on them. The sink had hairs on the counter. Our sheets had black smears on them. I asked for clean sheets and towels. The housekeeping staff needs to tie their hair back. I noticed that our maid did not change the bucket of water between rooms. This water was black. I recleaned the bathroom after she did every day. Curtain at patio door was torn and had red smears on it. Patios are not swept. The bolts on the railing of the 8th floor were loose. Floors are never vacuumed. Stains on tile. I will never stay here again. I was overcharged and suppose to receive a refund. So far it hasn't appeared on my visa

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: mookie1531
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was just wonderful. The room was clean and spacious. The jacuzzi tub was very relaxing. The view was nice. The staff was pleasant. We ordered room service from the restaurant and they were short staff that night so since we had to go down and get our order, they gave us a free appetizer and two free drinks at the bar for the inconvenience. We never had to ask for the room to be cleaned or for more bed and bathroom linen. I will definitely be returning for the 3rd time. Consuella was our housekeeper for both visits and she never stole anything from us.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeepers steal and manager is unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: GoinSomewhereElse
Reviews.Content: I returned three days ago from a weekend stay in OCMD. This was an annual trip of several friends. We had never stayed at the Paradise Plaza Inn before. The hotel was typical for Ocean City. Nice, yet nothing fancy. The lobby was relatively clean. We were pleased with the size of the room and the view. We paid approximately $250/night.....standard rate. What we were not pleased with was that our luggage was rummaged through by the housekeeping. $100 was stollen from one of the bags. Once I was able to speak to Dorran, the manager, he was not willing to do anything. (He was very hard to reach, conveniently) I had kissed my money goodbye when we realized it was missing. It's a shame that the housekeeper did not receive questioning from her manager. If you choose to stay there, be sure to lock your luggage when you leave your room. As fas as I know, Consuello is still employed at the Paradise Plaza Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: lillhoneybee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Easter weekend. We had an oceanfront jacuzzi suite. The room was huge and the view was perfect! Right on the boardwalk! The staff was a snooze. None of them looked too thrilled to be working but we had no problems. I even left my credit card at the front desk and they immediately called the room. We had only decaf one morning and they brought regular right up. The room was very clean. The tub was patched but what do you want right? They can't just put a new one in. It worked great! There is a bar/restaurant right on the second floor. From the outside it looks a little shady but inside wasn't bad. We'd definitley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Going down the drain”
Reviews.Author: psujack2007
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that my family and I have stayed at over the Easter holiday for the past several years. We have noticed the service and cleanliness of the place has slipped in recent years. If you are ONLY looking for a hotel with an excellent location on the boardwalk at a reasonable price, this is the hotel for you. However, if you are looking for clean rooms, friendly service, numerous amenities and a safe enviroment, then this is probably not the place for you. There is a restaurant/bar on the premises and a gift shop, but they are both a little seedy. The oceanfront rooms provide a nice view of the ocean and beach, but I would request the upper floors. The views are better and the noise from the boardwalk is diminished. A couple of glaring problems.......overall cleanliness, staff friendliness, 1 vending machine(never stocked), no hangers in room, no door for closets which makes room look sloppy, locks on sliding doors did not work. We asked to have the sliding door fixed, but it did not happen despite numerous requests. Try another hotel when in OC.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, if you like being ignored”
Reviews.Author: trvllvr7
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were celebrating our November birthday's. The hotel appeared to be nice and clean upon arrival. We asked for no smoking. Our room was across the hall from housekeeping.They smoked like chimneys.The heater in the room was loud,we reported it,it could not be fixed.We were told we could look at some other rooms,it never happened.There was old cereal on the floor and on one of the bed spreads. Our HBO went out halfway through our stay,we reported it, a number of times nothing was ever done. Someone kept trying our doors. We had one of those adjoining doors in our room. We reported that,but, noone ever came up to investigate,nor did anyone call our room to see if things were ok. That made me a little nervous, we're females.We made the best of a bad situation,because we refused to let the poor service ruin our vacation. After all we were there for five(5) days. The majority of the guests left on Sunday,we stayed till Wednesday. We felt that because there were so few people in the hotel,that the service could have been much better.That was our first and last stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: palmer175
Reviews.Content: My church's married couples' group met there in Feb. for a retreat. The staff at the hotel were very helpful, worked with us closely on what we needed with the hotel rooms and the conference room. Serviced the room promptly. We were very pleased with the whole experience. The staff here are great (especially you S.S.)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: bluiz1997
Reviews.Content: I was anticipating a much better stay based on some reviews here and was disappointed. I do not usually expect much from beach hotels and I must say this was a little better than what I would usually expect in a place like ocean city, Maryland. I was not in any way expecting a 5 star hotel. Some of the positives and negatives Note- We visited on Labor Day weekend and there was a storm the night before so I understand some of the issues. Negatives * There were dirty soaked mildew towel left on the floor near the sliding doors as there was water that entered due to the heavy rain no effort to clean up the room before we checked in. * Internet was slow to the point of being frustrating and useless * The front office staff was extremely rude and not accomodating while I did not have any huge problems...I did witness unhappy customers * The rooms were NOT cleaned even after repeated request. The cleaning ladies were not nice at all. They were very sloppy and lazy. Tile floors not swept or mopped once during our stay. (tile + sand= nasty!) * Sheets/beds uncomfortable- some with stains Positives *Location!!! Central to everything on the boardwalk. * Great crab bisque at the restaraunt (Jimmy's)

Reviews.Title: “Love the Paradise Plaza Inn”
Reviews.Author: neicy08
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on this board, I was a little skeptical about staying at the Hotel. But I have to admit, that I was glad that I did stay. The room were very clean and cleaned thoroughly every day. When we called down to the front desk for something it was bought up immediately, not later but within no time. I have to admit that I did not like the pool. But the kids did. So that was fine. Loved the fact that they had a restaurant in the hotel and the food was very good. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rs7921
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the ocean front room from 8/4-8/7/06. The rooms are very large compaired to other oc hotels we stayed in when they say can hold 6 people they can! The housekeeping does start around 9am but if you want to sleep in then just put your do not disturb sign on the door, they do a awesome job with cleaning the room! The rooms have a awesome view we watched the dolphins every morning! They do give you shampoo, soap, lotion which are bath and body works products and also 2 bottles of water, which I thought was great I have stayed in 4 star hotels that dont even do that. We had 4 adults in our room that took showers one right after the other and ALWAYS had hot water. Are sink stopper did not work reported to the front desk and it was fixed right away which is saying a lot since the hotel was full!! I have read in other reviews the complaints about the size of the pool yes it is small but average size for oc same as other hotels. Getting to the beach no problem you can either go through Dairy Queen or the sunsations shop plenty of room even when your carring stuff for the beach you would be amazed the results you get by just saying excuse me!!

Reviews.Title: “A little pricey for what you get ...”
Reviews.Author: BabyGirlAsh
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my stay at the Paradise Plaza Inn. First of all, the location was awesome. It was within walking distance of everything you could want and right on the boardwalk; my family and I stayed in the Dolphin Suite # 715. The view from the balcony was of the bay side because it's on the back of the hotel. (This room actually has 2 balconies, both bay view) The room was very, very spacious. It slept 6, so there was actually 2 bedrooms and a living area with each. The first bathroom was pretty big, and fairly clean. It was right there when you entered the suite; the 2nd bathroom was very large. It had a jacuzzi tub, which was very nice and a sitting area off the bedroom. On the outside the hotel looks pretty new and has been freshly painted. The lobby is spacious and nice as well. The staff there was very curteous and fulfilled our requests quickly. The maid service, just plain sucked, but I won't get into that. We got Bath & Body works toiletries which was nice and bottled water each day. The rooms could have been a little cleaner, but the carpet in this room looked new. The TV had some dust on it and underneath the bathroom sink did too. I think the outside had been remodeled and the inside still had not. The AC in our room sprang a leak on our 2nd day; we called the front desk and within 15 minutes it had been fixed, so I will say that was wonderful and not a problem at all. I would stay here again, but I do feel that the rooms are a little overpriced. For around the same price, we could have taken a nicer hotel, but there was nothing available. The pool was behind the hotel; it was small, but nothing to complain about. It did have the usual sand in and around it, but what else can you expect when you're at the beach? Right below the hotel is a Dairy Queen, which was nice. There was also a Candy Kitchen and 2 T-shirt Factories. There wasn't much parking. The first lot was usually full, but they do provide overflow parking diagonally across the street. As a matter of fact, you can see the overflow lot from the balcony. I prefer to park at the hotel, but walking a little, and only across the street isn't bad. It could be worse. We also reserved room # 712, on the same floor for additional memebers of my family. This room was a spacious room with 2 double beds and a balcony with a side view of the ocean. My only complaint with this room was that you had to share a balcony with your neighbors and the rest of the floors. There was hand railing the divided each one, but no privacy what so ever. You could look down on the people on the balcony below you because they stuck out further than this one. Someone could easily step over the rail right onto your balcony if they wanted to; there wasn't a gap or nothing between them. I didn't like this at all, but I did notice the oceanfront balconies were each individual balconies and you wouldn't have to be concerned with this if you were interested in that. Overall, I would give this place a thumbs up, but hope their prices drop a little for consideration of the ageing of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms and balcony”
Reviews.Author: davidrootsman
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying here. Each time was a pleasure. We had a room with a balcony large enough to have a rent party on. We found thje staff to be very nice and helpful. We showed up with no reservations , was asked if we had been there before , when we answered "yes" we were given a spectacular room . You also can't beat the location. Everything was within walking distance and driving wasn't needed. Will always use this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Ocean City..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this hotel. It is right on the boardwalk and only a few steps away from the beach. You should definitely get an ocean front room. The view is great! I always book a suite when I go. Very spacious and clean. I have also stayed in one of the dolphin suites which has two rooms connected with two private balconies. The staff have always been very friendly! I was just there in June, however it was senior week to my dismay. Definitely wouldn't recommend that unless you are a senior of course. Way too crowded. But, even then, it was an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wow had a great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a short weekend and had a great time it was soo close to the beach and boardwalk that we were never far from the action My kids had a blast also. I wish we had stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “My Anxiety was Unfounded....”
Reviews.Author: oicu812_12
Reviews.Content: I was concerned when I booked this hotel, having heard some horror stories from my daughter's friends who had been there on "Senior Week". I am thrilled to say my anxieties were unfounded. The room was great. Staff, though not the most outgoing crew, were very responsive. You can't beat the location and we plan to stay there with additional family in August. One request would be for the staff to clean the rain gutters. The beer / liquor bottles and cigarette butts caused the drains to fill up and spill over. It did provide some entertainment as we watched those below dodge the water....

Reviews.Title: “Love it here”
Reviews.Author: firstmom
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here for the past 3 years in a row and am going back this year. We have always stayed Oceanfront, but this year we are staying in a bayside suite for 5 of us. My family and I think this is the best hotel on the boardwalk. The rooms are huge and very clean. We have always had a private balcony and the management has been great. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"God's Call" youth choir loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ejjPortDeposit_MD
Reviews.Content: I actually booked the Paradise Plaza Hotel, for our youth choir's August 2005 mission trip, by viewing their web site. A little risky I know. I think the fact that we had terry robes each day sold me. (Ha Ha) Well it was absolutely wonderful. When we ALL arived at the front desk to check in via school bus, we caused mere havac. The group sales manager greeted me and promptly took care of our checking in process. She managed to get everything under control. Even at the end of our stay she personally called Grotos Pizza and asked if they would be prepared for a bus load of enthusiastic teens to arrive in about an hour. They kindly accomodated us also. (Thank you Lisa) The rooms were very roomy and clean. Most of the rooms that we booked sleeped 6 comfortably with a pullout sofabed. That was very useful to us since we had to provide rooms for 40 people. The kitchen areas were very useful to us. The teens loved the fact that there were shops right under us and an ice cream shop and I believe an Alaskan Stand where we ate lunch and dinner several times. The access to the beach and boardwalk were perfect. Even the guests there were very kind to our group along with ALL the employees. The maid service also was very efficient. The only slightly negative thing I would have to say was that the pool, even though it was clean and large enough, was kind of in an unusual location. It was too close to the parking lot in my opinion. The kids didn't mind that at all though. Our mission there, as a choir, was to spread the gospel by singing at the Sand Scultures and handing out tracts. This was a wonderful experience for the youth and the adults. "Thank You to Paradise Plaza Hotel."

Reviews.Title: “Always Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Paradise Plaza Inn in Ocean City, Md. every time we go there. We love it. We always get an Ocean Front Room and enjoy being so close to the Ocean and boardwalk. Its close to everything and has everything you need. We've never had a bad experience there and I am on my way back again next week for a 4 day get away. Ocean front again and loving it.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in one of the jacuzzi suites for a romatic weekend. Well there was nothing romantic about it. First of all we checked in and the front desk was not very nice and they did not have us register our car, which explains why we had no place to park when we retured for the evening, because apparently their parking is open to anyone. Also, the jacuzzi was in the bathroom? Yuck!! Also, on saturday we left at 12noon and returned at 9pm and we had not received maid serivce. We hung the sign on our door before we left, which was missing when we returned, we proceeded to call the front desk and the clerk informed us that housekeeping was gone for the day and he would bring us towels, well it took a hour and 2 phone calls later to eventually get towels! Overall I had a very bad expericence and will never stay there again and will never recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Better than expected! Room spacious and clean; bathroom sanitary and stocked with great amenities. Hotel staff extremely courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: RHLR
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Sunday, July 24 at about 1:pm. As soon as we got to the front desk they asked for our cars licence plate numbers and gave us a tag to put on the car rearview mirror. We reserved both the Dolphin Suites (they only have 2 of these rooms), one located on the 4th and one located on the 5th and both bayview. Between us was 4 adults and 7 teenagers ages 12-17. The suites included 1 bedroom with a queen bed, wet bar and bathroom and the main room had 2 queens and a pull out sofa, bathroom, micro, frig, safe, coffee maker, table with 2 chairs and lots of closet and drawer space. There is a balcony off both rooms with 2 chairs each. Housekeeping- Housekeepers start their day between 9-10 am each morning. We were told housekeeping only comes if you put out your maid service sign which we did. They start with the rooms checking out first. My family walked in on 2 different days to find 3 people in our room cleaning. I will give our room a 90% out of 100%. The bathrooms were spotless, furniture dusted and they vacuumed everyday but they really needed to pull out the dresser and night stand and clean behind them. Each day they left us plenty of towels, 2 bottles of water and Bath and Body shampoo, soap and lotion. Our sheets were changed twice during our stay. There is a note in the room saying they will only leave new towels in exchange for dirty towels because of the rate of towels that have been kidnapped in the last few weeks. Pool- we never used it but it is located outside the front door next to the parking lot. We go to OC for the beach not the pool so this was not an issue. Parking- You can park in front of the hotel or across the street. We did have to park across the street one night but again this was not a biggie for us. I have had to walk further to go into the mall or food store. Getting onto the beach- You can go through 2 of the stores or walk around the building. We never had any problems of bumping into anyone or anything. Fire Alarm- Our first night there someone pulled the alarm on the first floor at about 11:30pm. This happened 2 weeks ago and they DID catch the person. I wish them the same luck this time. We did get to meet a lot of nice people standing in the parking lot. We made the best of this situation! Robes- we had 4 robes waiting for us in the room. Housekeeping gave us more so each of us could have our own. Front desk- Very nice, very helpful, very friendly......same goes for the security guards. We will be going back!!!

Reviews.Title: “very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the paradise plaza on july 8th-10th. overal, it was a great time. when i was making the reservations i requested an oceanfront on the highest floor possible. they were very friendly to work with while planning my stay. when i got there, they gave us an oceanfront on the 7th floor. (the hotel is only 8 floors) it was a great room. bath & body works toiletries, clean, and comfortable. the rooms were sound proofed very well, i didn't hear any noise from the other rooms. my room was an end unit which had 2 queen size beds, jacuzzi, ocean front balcony and an ocean view patio. the patio was hugh. the hotel is right on the boardwalk and in the middle of everything. anything you need is right there from restaurants, bars, snack shops, sunsations, and a convience store right next to the hotel (which has anything you need, beer, wine, snacks, whatever.) the weather was great and the staff was terrific. i had read on a previous posting that the cleaning people would show up late to clean the rooms. i did not experience that. by early afternoon the room was cleaned. i really dont have any complaints about the hotel, the only thing i can point out is that there are only 2 elevators. only one of them will take you to the bar/restaurant, which was no big deal. i never had to wait around for the elevator. the pool is small and located in the back of the hotel by the dumpster, but i never used it because it was so nice on the beach. the main parking lot only holds so many cars, but they have another lot across the street. lastly, the first night the fire alarms went off at 4:30am and we had to evacuate the hotel for about an hour. (it really wasn't a problem either, the staff handled everything appropriately.) overall, i really enjoyed my stay at the paradise plaza. i have stayed in ocmd many times and plan on staying there again. i would definetly refer this place to a friend. (sorry about any spelling errors, i just wanted to post this over my lunch break)

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: One word, DISGUSTING. Upon our arrival, we come to find out that we have to park across the street because there is no parking spaces left. Then, we had to carry our luggage in because they didn't have any carts available. We paid top dollar because we wanted their jacuzzi room. The jacuzzi had patch work done to it which was evident by a huge plaster job smack dab in the middle of the tub. The rooms were small and on our last night stay, the bed smelled like beer which means that they either didn't wash the sheets or that they simple couldn't get the smell out, which in either case, it was DISGUSTING! The balcony was so small too. I am so angry over how much the cost of this terrible hotel was for what it had to offer us. This was the first time we were ever in Ocean City Maryland. We usually go to the Jersey shores. I gotta tell ya, their hotels and MUCH better there. The beach is the only thing nice about Maryland.

Reviews.Title: “Improved from Last Stay”
Reviews.Author: lsb040
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Paradise Plaza and felt it had improved since our last stay. The front desk staff was far more professional and mature than what we experienced in the past. The rooms seem well maintained and in overall decent condition. The oceanfront wall is nearly all glass, which gives a lot of light and there is plenty of drawer space. Little extras like the 2 bottles of water per day, the Bath & Body Works/Bio toiletries, coffee, cups, and the wall mount hairdryer (that works wonderfully) were all nice touches. The soundproofing of the room is better than most hotels - noise from other rooms was relatively minimal, especially in comparison to some of the other hotels in OC. One note - the smallish pool is situated in what amounts to being on the corner of the parking lot on the street side of the hotel. While the location is relatively unappealing, at least there is a pool, which some hotels lack. The housekeeping continues to be a bit of a mystery to me, as they seem to clean far later than most hotels. We found putting the "Housekeeping Requested" sign on the doorknob when leaving the room helped. Also, if you opt to forego housekeeping or miss it by having a Do Not Disturb sign out, they leave you a "Care Package" in a garbage bag that contains fresh towels, toiletries, toilet paper, cups, the daily bottled water, etc. This helped minimize my frustration when having the Do Not Disturb sign out for 15 minutes while changing resulted in not getting housekeeping two days. We will go back to the Paradise Plaza in the future, as we think it's one of the nicer hotels in OC. The location is ideal!

Reviews.Title: “Never recieved refund”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We actually really like staying at the Paradise Plaza Inn, however, we cancelled a reservation( for July of 05) on April 18 and have still not recieves a refund for the cancelled deposit. We have called every week and have been told everytime that the refund is in the mail. So BEWARE, you may never see the refund owed to you if you have to cancel.

Reviews.Title: “Same Time Every Year”
Reviews.Author: Beachbob
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Paradise Plaza Inn every year since our first stay five years ago. The hotel is convieniently located on the boardwalk, not too close to the downtown area but not too far away from the main attractions. The rooms are always clean, the staff has always been friendly and helpful, and the location is the best. The price of the rooms are average by Ocean City standards, the rooms are large enough for two people, there is a coffeemaker, dorm size refridgerator, and microwave oven. The Oceanview rooms have a good, angled view of the beach and boardwalk, the Oceanfront rooms have a great view of the boardwalk. Overall this is the best place we have found to stay in Ocean City in the 10 years we have visited.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon at the Paradise in October of 2002. We had a wonderful time! The room was spotless, and the jacuzzi was great! Spectacular view from the balcony, and the staff were very friendly! The hotel is in a very nice location...on the boardwalk, but far enough away from all the action that it is quiet. We will definitely stay at the Paradise Plaza again!

Reviews.Title: “Best ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and 5 of my friends stayed at the paradise plaza for senior week (JUNE 12 THUR JUNE 19, 2004) and we had the best time ever.....being young we were always in & out of the hotel all hours of the night and the security gaurds and staff were extremely nice about everything and didnt give us any hassle....for students planning on commin down to O.C for senior week next year....ALL I HAVE TO SAY IS PARADISE PLAZA!!!!
